content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												A decent game from more than a decade ago. But it may not be the game for you considering how long my con list is. Pros: 1.) The environment is nice and it's fun to explore around. 2.) There's a good amount of weaponry, ranging from a Desert Eagle to a rare and powerful automatic shotgun, the Pancor Jackhammer. If you favor stealth, pick a silenced MP5 and remain hidden. 3.) There aren't that many vehicles but it's forgivable if you can drive something that fires rockets and wrecks entire campsites. 4.) The A.I. enemies are impressive to fight against. Some operate like a squad and they tend to "think" (or pick stealth) more before assaulting your position. 5.) In my opinion, Far Cry offers outstanding music. It builds up and increases tension which is appropriate when you're exposed to assailants. 6.) Graphics are nice, considering this game is over 10 years old. However, there are problems that Far Cry has. Cons: 1.) Multiplayer is dead! There should be an update that states this in the store page. Link: http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=2092407Don't waste your time in registering for any site to get multiplayer. It has died long ago. 2.) Despite what some people said, a good portion of the campaign is linear, most notably the "indoor" parts. Also, the game doesn't do a good job in providing players with a diverse amount of alternative pathways to take. It usually only gives 2 avaliable walkways to complete the same objective and I do not find that acceptable. 3.) There's some sort of A.I. bug in which the mercenaries can shoot at you accurately behind walls when you're in their bunkers. EDIT: Stealth is also broken in this game. The human enemies can "see" you at certain points, even when they should not have. This prohibits the ability to sneak around them and often, you have to fight them head-on.4.) While I do not mind, a good amount of the Far Cry community despises the introduction of the "Trigens". In a way, I do agree with them because after you encounter them, the game becomes too different. 5.) I was going to complain about the bland plot but the voice acting is far worse. The main character, Jack Carver, has a pretty bad voice actor and his lines are cliche'd. 6.) Some sections of the game are notoriously hard, though not impossible to beat, even on easy. It would be understandable if you die almost immediately by rushing recklessly on the hardest difficulty but on easy is just overkill. The last level was hard but the worst part for me was fighting Crowe, the leader of the mercs, on a sinking boat while facing a helicopter. You only have a couple of minutes of destroy the aerial vehicle (as you cannot use a firearm when swimming), there's no supplies, and Crowe has good accuracy and he inflicts massive damage with his M249. 7.) The worst thing Far Cry has is the "auto-save" and it lacks the ability for players to save manually whenever they want to. I heard that there is a console command as compensation but for those who don't know, they will have endless times of reloading an earlier save and you may even get stuck in a loop where you continuously perish. Summary: In all, I did enjoy the game after adjusting myself and giving it a 2nd try. However, $9.99 is too much as multiplayer and customization is dead so please get the game when it's at a discount if you're still interested. On the bright side, Far Cry does have more balls than its successors when it comes to difficulty.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
												Reading the negative reviews for this has upset me a little.  It seems that the two main complaints people have are that the game is too hard and the story is somewhat lame.  I would agree that this is a hard game, it does not baby the player.  There is no regenerating health, the enemy soldiers move quickly and have decent aim.  I am not great at FPS games, but playing this game on medium is very enjoyable to me.  The checkpoints are very well spaced.  There are just enough health and armor packs.  If you are getting stuck in one spot I would suggest trying a different approach.  Maybe even back up one checkpoint and come it things from a different angle.  This is very different from the modern corridor shooters.  The maps are enormous and you are free to go anywhere.  I can see how this could be confusing for younger gamers used to COD style gameplay.  Boats and trucks are an excellent strategy with their mounted guns.  Stealth works very also.  Early game with the M16 switching to single shot mode, going prone and headshots from a distance is another good method.  Rushing in and spraying bullets will not work as well.  You will have ample ammo for your pistol and assault rifle, but much less for speciailzed weapons like the sniper rifle and rpg.  This keeps things balanced and rewards the player for good planning.  Final comments on the difficulty.  Everyone has different levels of skill.  For me on he hardest difficulty levels I can not get very far without getting stuck.  On medium the game is fun and I die maybe a couple times per level.  Select the level appropriate for your abilities.  Once you learn where the enemies are and how many that will give you an advantage.Technologically this game is a masterpiece.  Released 10 years and still looks great.  It is the predecessor to Crysis.  As for the story, who cares?  It is a game not a movie.  It is about the gameplay here.  Cut scenes are few and far between and non disruptive.  Nothing gets between you and pulling that trigger.  There are no QTE's or moments where the game takes control away from you.  It is a very pure experience.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
												The perfect first-person shooter for those who are tired of today's dumbed-down, military-themed games in the genre.It is fun and very, very challenging.  Ammo and health conservation need to be taken into account at all times, and the AI does a good job of making enemies always feel like a real threat.Despite not taking place in an "open-world" like its successors, the original Far Cry features some incredibly vast and well designed levels (at least for the first three quarters of the game), allowing the player to approach objectives in many different ways.The story is pretty entertaining, if a bit tongue-in-cheek. It has an 1980s' action-movie feel to it.If you can put up with its outdated graphics, Far Cry is well worth a playthrough.

content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												Even though this game is over 10 years old, it still looks beautiful. The graphics is actually so good, that is outshines some games released a decade later. But, there is always a butt! It takes too long before the story begins, and when it does, it is not very good. The A.I. is very stupid, and clearly programmed to not see you while you are moving in the vegetation. Other than that, they have no problems spotting you trough tents, bunkers and walls. They are also able to spot you further away than you can see, so you will have to use the binoculars to see who is shooting at you. I do not get the part with the mutants, it just feels weird. Other than that the game is pretty entertaining. The levels are a mix between “open world” (semi-open world with different paths that leading to the same goal) and linear. The game mechanics are good, which makes the game enjoyable. The hitboxes are good for a game this old, and you are rewarded for steady aim. The variation in weapons is not great, but it is good enough (should have been more weapons with silencer).

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
THIS GAME SCORES [0 | 1 | *2*] = ~83% (67%-100%)Since it has been a long while that I properly played this game, I'm not sure if I would give it a 3of4 or 4of4, so I'll cheat and give it a 3 of 3. :]To me, this is sadly the only true Far Cry game.While you have a lot of free roam space, you slowly work yourself from one campaign story location to the next. You fight in a (loose) jungle and get a proper feeling of being hidden between the bushes and creeping up on the enemy. The modern FC games also have this, but I think it's considerably less well executed.This Far Cry has no "YOU'RE LEAVING THE MISSION AREA!" crap, it's all just gameplay. You don't feel victim to the arbitrary whims of the game designer, it's your adventure.No obviously gameplay-stretching collector's items spread all over the map.No always same-y activities. Of course this game has a game loop where certain things repeat again and again, but repetition/similarity are on a different fractal level (Think Mandelbrot fractal zoom.) than the same-y repetitive stuff of modern Far Cry games.No long unskippable cut scenes.Saving whenever you want (OMG!).No questionably simulated civilians shooting in the air each and every time you complete a same-y activity involving them.This Far Cry is like the good old campaign first person shooters, except with an open world jungle and beach and swimming/diving in the water feeling. (Boy, when I played this back then on a 2.5 meter projection, it felt like a vacation!)Bring back the old school Far Cry already! Since Sameysoft seems to be too preoccupied forcing the same theme park formula into everything, maybe it's time for someone else to take over. How many/few games like the first Far Cry exist, anyway? Is there really only one?

content:
Posted: February 13
												INTRO:After playing Far Cry 3 a few years ago, I went crazy.I loved that game so much that I decided to be curious and look forward trying their other game series.Since yesterday, I finally finished Far Cry 1.I finished every Far Cry games on PC (except for Far Cry Primal that I can't afford for now x.x;;) and I decided to make a game review for each of those games. So I hope i'll do fine as in, English is not my first language :P________________GAME'S STORY:The Story is about a guy named "Jack Carver", that got paid by a journalist (aka Valerie Constantine) for some specific mission.They traveled on a boat and some soldiers shot the boat with a Rocket Launcher, which made you wake up on the beach, with no clue where did Valerie go.Your main mission will be to rescue her and you will receive help from Doyle.Other things will happen in the game but I won't spoil in that part :pThe Scenario is kind of decent. I am not a huge fan of this as in, we already saw a lot of those in this early years because it was very popular to make sci-fi games // games with scientists and creatures like Half-Life but since it's a old game and that it was popular at this time, we can forgive them about that. :P________________PROS & CONSPROS:- Graphics are beautiful for how old the game is- Gameplay is decent for their very first game release- Different types of weapons (Shotgun, Snipers, machineguns, grenade-launcher, etc..!)- The story is okay! Not the craziest, but it's okay :P- A good amount of interactions on the radio for the Story, making so the game is not empty at some parts- You can find some funny magazines that they customized, giving more interactions with the player if you ever decided to discover stuffs around and not only play the game- There is 20 levels to do in the game. (Levels, chapters, whatever you call that :P)- The game is fun overallCONS:- The scenario can get dumb at some part, and somewhy you'll see Valerie randomly almost naked at some point lol- The gameplay can get terrible: There is some part where you can't do multiple things at once (Moving forward while shooting, then you can't move to the left or right anymore, somewhy)- In some maps, NPCs can shot you through walls (mostly Army Tents) and it is pretty frustrating to die from someone that you can't even see.- The difficulty is insane.I am very good at video games, and I died A LOT on most levels.I played in Standard, which were the 2nd difficulty out of 5. I got forced to use some cheats at the very 2 last chapters because they were no way to win for me:7 rocket launchers shooting at you and you instantly die, rare checkpoints to heal you / get shields and/or ammos.I never had to cheat to win anygame in the past and I played tons of games, difficult, or not.- Some levels can seem very very very long while some can be short- Some levels are extremely hard to pass just for a small part of it that is insane to win IF I CAN GIVE YOU A TIP, DON'T PLAY IT IN STANDARD AND GO FOR EASY LEVEL. :V _________________Overall, it's a great game to play.Probably the scariest of the 4 games (by that I mean, that there is a moments where you are in the dark with obscure ambiance, and out of a sudden monsters jump on you)I'm not saying that Far Cry games are scary in general, though :PMUST PLAY. Peace. <3

content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												The first thing to remember about this game is that it is over 10 years old.  However, 10 years later, it is still a great game to play.  The graphics are really nice for such an old game, and the envorinment is great.  The foliage and varying terrain provide great cover and lookout spots.  However, I do think the game misses out on a destructible environment, but this is mostly due to its age.  I would also call it open world, but it it does have linear aspects.  By this, I mean that there can be several routs and combinations you can employ to achieve objectives, but all of them guide you to the objective (i.e. an island will have 3 to 5 paths to get to the center, and each path will suit a different play style).  When you get inside places like the labs, the mission will become linear.  Personally, I was not bothered by this because that is how I feel it should work.  In real life, buildings are not supposed to have complicated floor plans, and it mixed it up from the open outside areas.  Together, these two set different tones and forced you to alter your play style and rely on different tactics.What I was most impressed by in this game was was the A.I.  They actually  act like thinking people in a lot of situations.  An example of this is them "listening" for your footsteps and other noises you make.  Another example is that they will operate in groups or squads, and will often to choose tactical approaches to get to you,  They are a challenge, but to me it makes the game feel more "real" and creates a fun challenge.Another thing I think the game gets right is the music.  It is incredible.  It comes on at appropriate times at the right volume for the perfect amount of time.  It does not take away fromt the game at all.Some of my final thoughts on the game include the voice acting, levels, and multiplayer.  Your character especially could use some improvement, but frankly, speaking is such a small part of the game that it barely matters.  You will actually probably laugh at it for most of the game, so it is not necissarily a bad thing.  The combinination of the A.I. and environent do create some incredibly tough levels.  However, they are all beatable, you just need to think outside the box sometimes.  Besides, what is a game without a challenge?  Finally, the multiplayer is dead, but lets be honest.  The game is old, its part of a popular franchise.  If you want multiplayer, get the newer games.Overall, I think this game is fantastic, and I would highly recommend this game.  I would buy the games when it is on sale, especially as part of the franchise pack, because the standard price is just too much.  The good news is that it is on sale all of the time.  I hope you this review is helpful, that you would consider getting the game, and I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.  Enjoy!

content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
												Far Cry was designed as the dream-come-true FPS game of some ambitious newcomers at gamedev stage - Crytek studio. Their first known project turned out as the real bomb when it was released. The hype was immersive - and after all those passed years, I have to say, this game is worth its reputation."Thunder in Paradise" rich setout unleashes badass oldschool shooter (like Doom or Half Life) - with so many fixes as one could imagine 12 years back: outstanding visuals and physics, witty and challenging level design, clever AI behavior... And level editor for icing the cake.I remember playing (and ending) this game in 2004-2005, with the hardest difficulty possible. The last level was utterly hard, and it changed my mentality forever. Seriously. Now I have but one fear in my life. My only fear is about ammo depletion. So far as I'm locked and loaded, let'em come!Well, sadly, my skill was decreased since those times, so now I am good enough only at "challenging", medium level difficulty. For the newcomers, however, I suggest to start from the basic level of difficulty - the standarts was really different then.I've read many depressing comments about this game from people who decided to give it a try, but was not ready for the outcome. Enemy soldiers are not aim-bots, that's I know for sure. If you're good with positioning and tactical movement in the rough terrains, if you're lucky... and if you're ready for constant reloads... Try it on!The game is selling for such a low price, that every FPS devotee should have no problem with adding this brilliant to the collection. The only real question before buying should be - are you really bad enough for this? You can't hide behind chest-high wall here and recover health. The enemies, once you'll allow them to spot you, will be engaging until you'll finish them all or die trying. Some of them will be crying for backup (and usually, they'll get one), some will be cornering you, while others will rush on you, using supressive fire, grenades and strafing moves... And all that you'll see right from the beginning!As for downsides: saving only at checkpoints is really annoying! Sometimes those checkpoints too far one from another, sometimes, when you crouch your way around enemy, you can not activate any checkpoint at all! And sometimes checkpoints are saving the game just the second before enemy sniper blows your head off. Some levels, otherwise quite well-performed, could become total clusterfunk due to those fixed savepoints. Like the upper level of the tanker, where you have only about 0.5 to 1 second to hide once you've climbed there, before bullethell breaks loose. Or later, in the second half of the game, where some enemies are getting on another level of the food chain... My advise there is to find tweakguide with using console around this problem. Or get over with it as it is!My mark is 8/10. Clever engine and gameplay, nice physics. We don't have scarcity for FPS games, that's right. But if you need FPS where you are not tied to corridor shootouts... Where you exploring the area around before engaging - or instead of it - to learn enemy's routes, behavior, weakpoints... Where you have to worry about not being hit more than about fragging another dozen of dummies - now, there's still not many good games like this.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2013
												Somewhere during the late 90s and early 00s, first-person shooters grew increasingly more linear and tightly-scripted. This was largely due to the development time required for a relatively small team to create more open, non-linear environments with complex 3D architecture. As much as I enjoyed some of these linear shooters (No One Lives Forever and Star Trek Voyager: Elite Force spring to mind), I was starting to miss the days where I could walk into a room and discover three or more doors leading out of it. Also a little nervous that non-linear shooters were a thing of the past.Thankfully Far Cry allayed those fears from the get go, presenting the player with nearly endless vistas, huge islands to be explored, enemy encounters that could be approached in a variety of ways. It felt like a brand new yet also warmly nostalgic gaming experience. Far Cry was the first game I chose to play on a newly-built PC system back at the start of 2005. I also had Half-Life 2, Doom 3, Quake 4, Thief: The Deadly Shadows and Deus Ex: Invisible War waiting in the wings. Far Cry came free with the video card, so I decided to "get it out of the way" first, only to end up entranced for about 12-15 hours and finding it to be one of the strongest of that particular set of unplayed games.Thank you, Far Cry, for helping bring back non-linear environments to the FPS genre at a time when it desperately needed them.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
Far Cry® Review - Rating: 8.6/10General ImpressionFar Cry® is a pretty nice action-based game. The graphics are relatively nice, but for 2004, they are spectacular. The textures are not very special either, but for 2004, they are well-made. The atmosphere varies a lot, from enemy camps and military bases, forests, waters and mountains. There are health kits, weapons, ammunition, binoculars, and even other useful items along the atmosphere. Also, sometimes you will be able to drive jeeps, and in certain missions, small air boats. The audio is pretty nice, I like the sounds of the guns. It sounds realistic. The music is also ambient-type and nice. The voice acting is alright. The gameplay is relatively an open-world style, where you need to go to specific places, to either kill your enemies, put a bomb on a place, or simply reach the evacuation point, and even other types of objectives. There are many scenarios, which will take at least one hour to complete (each one of them). Be aware: this game is pretty hard. Even on the easiest difficulty. If you are a casual player, I do not recommend this game to you. The story is well-thought, everything has a chronological order and it’s pretty interesting. The user interface is well-optimized, with no bugs and a pretty nice design. For less resourceful people, this game might be harder. You need to figure out ways to get to the place of fighting and what to do. The controls are neat. The engines are alright, I haven’t met any bugs, crashes, screen freezes or frame drops. Hence I have found several minor bugs, they will not bother you at all. The mechanics are pretty sophisticated, everything moves pretty realistic. Also, when you kill your enemies, they fall pretty realistic. Overall, Far Cry® nice action-based game, with relatively nice graphics, a fantastic atmosphere, enjoyable audio and music, a good gameplay and pretty nice mechanics.Positive PointsRelatively nice graphics and pretty well-designed texturesPretty nice audio and nice musicFun and challenging gameplayMany missions throughout the scenarios available3 difficulties available (even on the easiest one, this game is pretty damn hard)A pretty nice designed user interfaceOpen-World gameplay alikeSome pretty stable enginesSome pretty nice mechanicsNeutral PointsSteam achievements and trading cards would be some nice featuresA note to casual players: You will rage a lot on this gameNegative PointsThis is only a negative point for less resourceful gamers: Hence this game does have a waypoint system (a bar with the cardinal points), you will still have a pretty hard time finding the places/objectives It has several minor bugs, but they are not very important

number of helpful: 48 of 61 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Far Cry is a first-person shooter action game developed by Crytek and published by Ubisoft in 2004. It was a surprise for its advanced graphics engine and artificial intelligence .Jack Carver, a retired soldier, is hired by Valerie to explore an island. On the island, Doctor Krieger is involved in a genetic engineering project called "Far Cry" guarded by large numbers of mercenaries. There are also primates undergoing genetic serum treatment that converts them into aggressive monstrosities. The game is extensive and has a remarkable variety of levels for the time.The graphics engine was called CryEngine and it was a revolution at the time. It could show the outside world and vegetation in great detail. The image quality was surprising because everyone expected the best games to come from the hand of Id Software , Valve or Unreal . Far Cry managed to surpass these industry monsters on open outdoor environments. At that time one was stupefied seeing and walking the surrounding rainforest. Handling vehicles added an interesting gameplay add on.The experience of hang gliding on tropical islands was unique and later copied by several games like the wonderful 2013 Far Cry 3Game.The game was released for Windows PC with recommended CPUs from 2 to 3 Ghz, 1 GB of RAM and 128 MB graphics cards supporting DirectX 9.0b . Many video cards suffered enough with this game in 2004.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ESPAÑOL--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Far Cry es un juego de acción en primera persona desarrollado por Crytek y distribuido por Ubisoft en 2004. Fue una sorpresa por su avanzado motor gráfico y la inteligencia artificial. Jack Carver, un soldado retirado, es contratado por Valerie para explorar una isla. En la isla se encuentra el Doctor Krieger involucrado en el proyecto de ingeniería genética “Far Cry” custodiado por gran cantidad de mercenarios. En la isla hay además primates sometidos a sueros genéticos que se han covertido en monstruosidades agresivas. El juego es extenso y tiene una variedad de niveles notable para la época.El motor gráfico se denominó CryEngine y  para la época fue una revolución en mostrar el mundo exterior y la vegetación. Maneja HDR (alto rango dinámico) y nubes volumétricas. La calidad de la imagen fue sorprendente, ya que todos esperaban que los mejores juegos vengan de la mano de Id software, Valve o Unreal. El Far Cry consiguió superar a estos monstruos enos entornos exteriores abiertos. En aquél momento uno se quedaba estupefacto viendo la selva tropical circundante. Además el manejo de vehículos le agregaba una jugabilidad muy interesante.La experiencia de volar en ala delta por islas tropicales fue única y copiada posteriormente por varios juegos como el Maravilloso Far Cry 3 del 2013.El juego se lanzó para PC bajo Windows, se recomendaban procesadores de 2 a 3 Ghz, 1 GB de memoria RAM y tarjetas gráficas de 128 MB con soporte DirectX 9.0b. Muchas tarjetas de video sufrían bastante con este juego en 2004.

number of helpful: 35 of 40 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2013
												Far Cry was Crytek's flagship game, and they definately left a lasting impression on the gaming industry as a whole.The maps are gigantic tropical islands that you tend to explore only 10% of by going through the linear path. There's a huge amount of detail and a map editor to design your own islands with.That's not counting the single player experience itself. Which teaches you by experience rather than a tutorial. Inorder to take out a base of enemies you have to use stealth tactics and guerilla warfare, all of which take thinking and strategy to properly pull off. Picking the game up today will result in dying very often due to the intelligent AI, but you'll adapt, conquer, and survive. Playing this game is indeed like being on a vacation.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2015
												Well, you should know that this game is the FPS version of Dark Souls. You're gonna die a lot. If you like the games where the victory is simply served to you, you should avoid this game. Now the real rewiev:+The graphics are pretty good for a game that was made 10 years ago.+The game is really hard, which makes it better because after you beat a part you were stuck for a while, you feel rewarded.+The story is very well thought even though it's not really realistic for a man to slaughter his way up to the end.+There is a plot twist at the end, which I didn't see it coming and was surprised.+It isn't short. I finished the game on medium difficulty in 14 hours.-There is a glitch in the game, that makes you visible even when you are in a tent or hiding in bushes.-The enemies just start to shoot at you from meters away, when it is actually impossible for them to even see you coming.-You can't really sneak because the enemies hear the lightest footstep and start shooting at you.-There is not enough checkpoints, so if you die at a point you have to redo all the thing even it was incredibly hard.Do I recommend this game? Hell, yeah. If you want a good challenge while playing a good game, get this gem.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2016
												Old but still awesome! +intelligent,strong & different enemies+challenging+you won't get bored+always something happens+everywhere enemies+different weapon types+story is good+very much action+a display of enemy's attention towards you+everything's stays on the map (except the corpses); so you can take ammo, or sth. else later+many vehicles +many ways to kill enemies, for example with overdriving or with rolling barrels+many different ways to finish a mission+/- graphics are good(for year 2004)+/- no skilling system+/-Your health doesn't regen-bad voice effects(you don't understand them during a video)-there is no really "easy" difficulty -No subtitels-you can't change the game-difficulty during the game-many bugs & glitches(but they won't disturb you)-no save system(you can't save your game on your own,only with checkpoints)You're a retired marine soldier, who get his money through driving his boat. This gets destroyed by unknown soldiers.Then you go & find a man who tell you how you can defeat them. During your adventure you will find out, why the soldiers are there & why they bombed your boat.This is a typical action& stealth game. You can't take for example your shotgun, run to 4 guys, try kill them & survive this attack. You have to sneak, hide like Rambo & fight like him, in other words:you spend most of your time crouching or crawling. This is not always easy, because the enemys as mentioned before aren't stupid, they won't stay at their place & wait for you! They will follow you & they can hide themselfs.At last they can take much damage(except the head), you will also meet them rarely alone.If you shoot them from far away they will shoot back or go to your position. I mean, if they noticed you one time, they will never come back to their old positions, if possible they will follow you through the whole map, so you must locate & kill them before they do the same with you. Also you must be prepared for every situation, you cant shoot during all the game with the same weapon.In the middle of the story you will have to sneak/crouch because the special forces are just...badass. You can't skill your character during the game, he will always stay the same, so you will/must become better.So if you aren't very good at FPS games, don't buy it, it wouldnt be good for you.However I recommend this game for players who search for a challenge.9/10***If you survive & finish this game on the difficulty realistic, you can beat/rank up/win in csgo or any other multiplayer games easily.***

content:
Posted: March 11
												This game is from 2004, but its worth every penny.  One of my first FPS games and I still love it.  Its 5 difficulties and many players have serious troble in the first.  There are somethimes you just have to shoot youre way in and others use stelth to get to the end point.  The most importent thing is to mark enemies with binoculars  before you enter an area, maybe go up on a hill or take a sneakpeak.  Also those on far distance and especially those in towers or on hilltops.  Use armed cars (humvee and buggy) when you move outdoors and even boats.Its playable on all win computers (and maybe Mac or Linux) and you just DL, install and start play.  Like all Steam games; verify file catch for every game you DL and install.  Thats a good thing do do before you start playing.  Steam has ver. 1.4 -32 bit and no other patches is needed.  You can install -64 bit, but you dont have to.  you get some more locations in levels (places to find more sniperammo, grenades), more explosives in areas/bases (shoot to explode and kill mercs) and slighly better textures.  But i play them both seperatly and didnt do it all, as wrote in guide for -64 bit (renameed bin32 to bin32.bak and bin64 to bin32) - Only to have steam overlay in -64bit version.  I let them stay as seperate games.  And for all new players (and old too):Make a new profile for each difficulty you play (never use default) and you can play -32 bit or -64 bit and use same profile for both.  Then you later can go back to a lower level to check out other ways or places to explore if you get into trouble in harder difficulties.  In the last you will get a lot of problems...   goood luck

number of helpful: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												Being the first entry in the series, this game makes honour to its name. Despite being quite old, it still manages to be a good game, although it presents several problems that impact negatively against its overall quality. The AI, for example, while good for flanking the player and working together, feels unfair since they can see the player through walls, and they spot you quite easily, so stealth isn't as fun as it should.There's a good variety of enemies to fight, with different weapons and skills, but, as mentioned, there are problems with them. Another problem is that some can kill you quite easily before you even spot them. As for weapons, there's different types, and they all work very good.The environments are impressive. From beaches, to old Japanese bunkers (and ships) from WWII, going through jungles, swamps, and even a volcano, this island has everything; and you can use several vehicles to move around.As far as the story goes, it's like a cheesy 90s action film. Not to say that's bad, since it really fits the tone of the game; and, let's be honest, jumping out of a jeep as it falls from a cliff towards the ocean is something that makes you feel awesome.All in all, I recommend it, even though it made me rage a bit.

number of helpful: 9 of 9 people (100%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
												In Far Cry you shoot, you hide, you cry and you die A LOT!It's an open world game where you have free choice how to approach enemies. You can try several tactics and see what works the best for you. It's not run and gun kind of game. You will need to go stealth very often. Trust me you will feel much better when they don't know about you. The last thing you want is a rocket into your face!Causions! It's a game which can cause you high level of frustration! It doesn't have quick save option so you just have to hold your breath and hope for next checkpoint before you get killed from the very last survival hiding somewhere so well that even your binoculars didn't register him! And then all the hard long work starts over ;)There are some bugs.. sometimes they make it easier for you but mostly harder. If you think you never swear, you will when experiencing some unfair situations in this game when you do nothing wrong and still get smashed like a ripe tomato!I really like and enjoy Far Cry, the combination of frustration and satisfaction after finishing hard missions. I like hiding in bushes and taking enemies one by one. I like all the cute mutants in game and they like me too obviously.. they cuddled me so much! Very deadly cuddles!I would recommend the game to everyone who likes good old games and who has the time and patience to retry missions. With Far Cry you will feel like your other games got so much easier!

content:
Posted: December 20, 2016
 Pros  Solid and satisfying overall gameplay Excellent graphics, even to this day Fairly long in length Reasonably impressive gore Large level variety and scale, everything from beaches to japanese bunkers to vast scientific facilities Levels are open to exploration Almost no filler levels Reasonably effective stealth system Decent enemy variety Talkative protagonist Trigents are a unique aspect not commonly found elsewhere Creepy and unnerving without the use of jumpscares Neutral  Voice acting is laughable at times. Driving is a bit wonky, but workable Cutscene animation is overtly cheesy The selection of weapons is somewhat small No crosshairs, with the exception of scopes Opening sequence doesn't make any sense Cons  Enemies have nearly pin-point accuracy, even on lower difficulties Enemies have wallhacks through certain types of walls Plot basically boils down to "We came, we saw, we killed everyone" Some level sequences feel long-winded Armoured enemies occasionally shed off rifle bullets like dandruff With the exception of explosives and the sniper rifle, enemies can take infinite amounts of bullets at longer ranges Physics engine is likely to kill you with inanimate objects A driving sequence that's likely to kill you multiple times because of the aforementioned aimbot An escort missing where the NPC will probably drop under a bridge, unable to move Final score:  8.7/10

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Oldie but goodie, Nominated this one for the "WHOOOAAAAAA, DUDE!" award simply because even today this game is still miraculous. The combat system in it's series is bar none; the story in it's series is top notch, and honestly no other Far Cry can even come close to how awesome this one is. This is still my favorite Far Cry even having played all of them, the engine is just simply better in every way. Back in 2004 this is the one game game developers wished they had on their resume. This game is from back when Ubisoft cared about the quality of their games, and made strives to make every element of them astounding. Sadly their quality is no better than EA's or late Bethesda's, it's horrible when Developers/Publishers get lazy but you can always appreciate the gems they put out for us.Graphics: 10/10Even today I can't believe how amazing this game still looks, even modern games nowadays still barely match it's par in performance and aesthetic. It's either the graphics are too complicated for most computers to run optimally, or the graphics have to be dumbed down enough to meet in the middle. Far Cry is a benchmark and example you can literally do both if you put actual effort into your game. Developers nowadays don't have the same inspiration as they used to, every game that comes out nowadays just seems like a rushed pile of crap. Bonus points for no ♥♥♥♥♥♥ motion blur, or awful looking bloom/HDR. Being honest I CANNOt stress enough how awful motion blur is, andshould NEVER EVER be used in a game. This game passes the perfect 10 test by having everything it needs, and not including options it doesn't need.Engine: 9.5/10Everything is cohesive and works great, as well as FPS is stable and it's performance runs smoother than a brand new Chevy. There's an option for everything you could possibly desire, it runs smooth and even lower end duo-cores with low profile GPU's can possibly run this on max settings. At least my old dual-core could, and the thing would STILL pump out 100+ FPS without even dropping below 90. This engine is the definition of perfection, and this game is the perfect example of it's capabilities. Some downsides are how dated it might seem even today, but to be honest besides how useless melee weapons really are in the game the combat system is quite nice overall.Customizability: 10/10The game has everything you need, every option you could/need want is there for your choosing. Truly no afterthoughts with customization, sadly multiplayer is no longer a thing unless if you're fine with private server trackers (which normally have an ample amount of cheaters.) There's very loose modding support, but considering it's an older CryEngine game, you really can't take points off for that.Interface: 10/10The menus are sensible and very aesthetically pleasing, everything is simplified and not overly complicated. For a game of it's time, it seems in the interface there are no afterthoughts. It even has a developer console in case if you feel like exploring the island a little more.Functionality: 10/10This game has never crashed for me, not even in the earlier versions. The quality assurance of this game must've been on point because I VERY rarely run into any glitches in multiple playthroughs. Once in awhile something might spawn inside a mountain, but if anything it's great for a laugh.Sound: 8.5/10One of the lower points of this game is the sound, and it's levelling/zoning. To be honest it's not terrible whatsoever, but some sounds are lower quality than others and stick out more. Some sound zoning can be quite confusing as npc's in certain positions will actually some how play a ventriloquist and seems like they're either farther or closer away at times. With having a dedicated soundcard and Sennheiser headphones, I feel if anything this is more of the game's issue than mine. Although the atmosphere is really just fine, this game was definitely not made for 3D sound emulation.Overall: 9.7What can I say? This old gem still holds it's own weight even today, the game is just fun to play and has a great storyline attached to it.  Was definitely worth whatever I spent on it, not that I ever remember how much it was to begin with. If you see this on sale consider picking it up, although keep in mind it's astounding for 2004 it's still from 2004! If you want to experience a gem from the early 2000's, and happen to be fond of Adventure FPS games with slight roleplay elements then considering dropping a few bones on this. Maybe Ubisoft will finally take a hint, and start actually trying to develop games like they used to. You know, with love, dedication, and some applications of elbow grease here and there.

												I'd have to say this is probably crytek's best game. The graphics hold up even by today's standards. Gameplay is not perfect but its ok. The AI is extremely tough, maybe a bit cheap, and expect to die and die a lot. Having completed it on realistic difficulty, at first I thought what a load of bs. Then I realized that is how the devs wanted the game to be. You have to plan your attacks by tagging enemies on your binocs and then you either have to pick off enemies from a distance with an assault rifle or go prone and sneak up on them with a suppressed smg. No regenerating health either. You have to look for medkits and armour. Overall I would recommend it for players who like a tough challenge. Definitely more fun than Crysis.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												My god! It has really been 10 years since this game was released! It truly is unbelievable how time flies!Anyway, this is one of those FPS games that I consider a milestone in the genre. Came out around the same time as Half Life 2 and Doom 3 did. I remember playing FPS games with corridors and relatively big rooms but never a game where you have a completely open island at your disposal and you can go wherever you want. Also, the game's engine handled these scenes very well and the frame per sec value did not drop significantly once you left a building and were in the open.The story is quite silly, actually. You escort a journalist to an island then suddenly a rocket destroys your boat. Now, being stranded on this island, your only chance of survival is to go deep into the jungles. You'll soon find out why there are so many mercenaries with several bases here and what cruel experiments they've been conducting for a while.The game was really beautiful at the time and beside the open-door areas it gave you the option to commandeer vehicles. This was also new at the time and this was refined later on in Crytek's Crysis. As much as I thought the story of Far Cry was lackluster I thoroughly enjoyed this game and did several walkthroughs.

content:
Posted: March 5
												First thing to say, this game has a rather drastic difference compared to the other far cry games. Mutants, yup, you read that right; Mutants. I wont say too much more on the subject as it is a key part of the story.Please don't let the Mutants put you off, this is still a great game with a decent story and fun gameplay. This took me around 12 hours to complete the campaign on the difficulty set on challenging but difficulties can be changed by to easy, normal, veteran or realistic. As you can imagine realistic is a nightmare but adds some replay value to the game as there are no collectibles.In total there are 20 missions for you to complete and there is some exploration to be done if you desire to do so. This exploration is not like other far cry games in an open world but each mission is quite vast so you can check out different buildings etc to find guns, armor and other useful items.You will find a range of weapons and vehicles to assist in completing missions. Weapons range from pistols, assault rifles, SMG's, sniper rifles and rocket launchers, some weapons also have an alternate fire mode such as a grenade launcher or changing fire rates. As for vehicles you will experience cars, boats and hand gliders.There is also a mulitplayer mode on the main menu when you start this game but it requires a ubi.com account; therefore I decided not to try this mode out but if it does work; chances are that no one would be playing anymore.One final note; the graphics for this game are still rather impressive seeing as that at the point of this review the game is 13 years old, and even better; almost every GPU from the last 10 years or every GPU from the last 5 years will be able to play this game with max settings.This is a good game and I definitely recommend it. As mentioned previously, try not to let the Mutants put you off.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												There's 'fun' difficult, then there's 'unfair' difficult. This definately qualifies as 'unfair' difficult. Stealth kills are a no-go as far as I know, since apparently the enemy is telepathically linked and KNOW when you stab one of their guys even if they didn't shoot nor yell or were seen, and immediately coordinate lock on your location. They also can perfectly shoot you through bushes and tent walls as if they had Xray hacks. That's just the first 30 minutes. If that's how it's going to be on "Normal" difficulty, I think I'll pass. I dunno why they even bother with the rock throwing mechanic because if you kill one guy, no matter how quiet, they know exactly where you are and you cannot hide.I understand other games are like that, but this game exists on the premise of tactical gameplay. But you can't exactly be tactical with mercinary psychics. You are better off playing this as if it were Doom or something. While that may not be bad itself, it seems strange in a tropical environment with bushes that realistically you could sneak around in.The story is shakey even from the start. For one, after a brief acid trip, some CIA dude I guess somehow KNEW exactly where you'd be and left a phone for you to contact you with. I dunno I guess everyone in the game has a 6th sense but you...unless of coarse you beat the game already. All I can say is this game has a cronic case of game logic.I did not encounter any of these problems in Farcry: Instincts, so I assume obviously Ubisoft listened to the negative feedback with this game and fixed it for the alternate remake.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												One of the classic FPS games that set the new standard in gameplay and graphics in its time.  The jungle scenery and island panoramic views were and still are breathtaking.  The ability to take a different approach to a single situation rather than being led on a rail to each action segment made the game very flexible for many players.  Once you enter the hallways though, the game turns more into a Doom clone where you only have one path to choose and you are faced with a new type of enemy that again evokes memories of Doom.  As a whole the story is interesting and gives you meaning to why you are fighting for your life.  I like your companion that helps you throughout the game to give you directions on where to go and what to do as well as giving background to the storyline.  The storyline consists of your boat, while on vacation, being shot down as you travel near an island.  You recover in the island and start playing cat and mouse to survive only to realize that this was no accident and the crew of your boat were purposely near that island.  But why?  What is so important about THIS island?  Play and find out, definitely a classic for all gamers to experience at least once.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2014
												Despite being a 10 year old game, FarCry still manages to impress with its dated graphics and gameplay mechanics. Games back then struggled to balance gameplay with open worlds as most computers at that time simply could not handle the processing power. Yet Crytek and Ubisoft decided to take that extra step and prove everyone that they could make a giant game for its time.There is no question that the islands that you play on are huge. While the game is not true “open world” per say, it still offers amazing space to test out your strategies. The game is linear in a sense that you progress through “zones”. Each zone has its own small enemy settlements, vehicles, and random events. Some zones are very linear while others promote exploration and different use of tactics. This is where FarCry is at its best. FarCry becomes so much fun when you as the player can figure out your own strategy in how to take down the enemy. Will you fly above your enemies and try to land on their base? Drive up in a armored vehicle and blast your way through? Perhaps take the underground passage and surprise your enemy. Or simply drag your enemy out into the jungle where you pick one by one.Yet there are moments where FarCry will feel like a totally different game. Halfway through you are forced to play within confined walls and shoot “Trigens” or mutated human soldiers who do ridiculous jumps and can one shot you, making gameplay extremely frustrating. To make it even worse, the game’s autosave feature saves seldom, making dying even more infuriating. Luckily, this can be fixed by a quick in console command.Make no mistake, FarCry is a very difficult game. Perhaps one of the most difficult I have ever played on hard. But it isn’t the “fun” type of difficult. It’s more of the bullcrap type where enemies have unlimited rocket launchers, grenades, and machinegun ammo while you run out quickly. Additionally, the game breaking bugs such as enemies spotting you behind walls and managing to shoot you behind tents and knowing exactly where you are makes stealth rather useless. It’s as if the game is taunting you that it could be much better had stealth actually worked.The game’s story is nothing noteworthy as it suffers from stereotypical clichés, boring characters, and a villain who makes little to no sense. FarCry does, however, do a good job in making you feel like a predator throughout the game. At times, you can feel the effect you have on the world as your enemy gets more and more frightened by you.Last but not least, the game has some serious glitches that makes gameplay infuriating. Saving during the zone called “Swamps” and loading is not possible after the car chase as the save always becomes corrupt. The only way to complete that part is to simply not die. Which when you play on hard, is not very easy to do. Additionally, the BS enemies who can snipe you miles away while you cannot even see them within distance is another part of the game which may make you want to throw your controller or mouse at the monitor. For being a 10 year old game, Ubisoft sure has not spent time in fixing some of these serious glitches, and it’s a problem since they are selling the game with these glitches.Overall, unless you are a classic FPS lover who wants to experience the very roots of the FarCry franchise, you won’t be finding much here. FarCry is both fun and maddening, and the bugs certainly do not help. It can be fun, however, to try the open zones and play the game when it is at its best. I certainly recommend that.Score: 6/10

content:
Posted: April 23
												Crytek is a developer that knows how to create near perfect first person shooters. Far Cry is another of those examples from their repertoire. This is some great, solid stuff, despite the bugs and glitches. A game to remember. Far Cry is hard. A true challenge even at the easier difficulty settings. Performance is an issue even for today's hardware standards. The game seems to need a fresh system restart to run at its full potential. There are plenty of bugs and glitches. Some were so major that I was forced to reload a save point several times. The game engine and physics is different than most other games, and this takes a little getting used to. The main character's voice acting is pretty bad. Almost to the point of making it sound like a comedy. For whatever idiotic reason, the game alters the Windows audio settings to its liking without setting them back to their original state. This is extremely annoying. Staying in the subject of sound, do a Google search and you will see the massive amount of sound problems people experience in this game. To access the multiplayer portion of the game, one is forced to register and create an account with Ubisoft, which is absolutely ridiculous. The developers clearly reward players who specialize in stealth and skill shots rather than running and gunning. The atmosphere, mood, and setting are superb; providing a tense and exciting experience almost every second of the game. The tension you will experience is not often produced by other games at this same level. There are many parts where you will be spooked and surprised by what comes around the corner or appears suddenly. It is all done very well. Level design in this game is outstanding. The AI is good, and there is always a challenge. Far Cry is all thriller, no filler. It took me about 17 hours to complete.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												Summary: A challenging, but rewarding and realistic old-school FPS.Sale Price: $2.50 (what I paid)Pros:-The difficulty (I'll count this as a pro). I played it in the middle difficulty (out of five) and it was, by far, the hardest FPS I've ever played. The whole game forces you to rely on split-second timing and perfect long-distance aiming to survive. This makes you much more tense than newer FPS with regenerating health ever seem to do. You're often forced to methodically clear areas slowly and precisely, which is much different than most run-n-gun games these days. Far Cry 3's hardest difficulty was significantly easier than this.-The stealth works very well. Your only chance at survival is to creep around in the woods. The "attention meter" is your best friend. Also your night-vision goggles are essential at spotting enemies in the distance and in the dark.-The AI is very advanced for the time. The bad guys will sound alarms to bring in help (which was reused in FC3), and will  take cover. However, they do occasionally do stupid things that shows how old the AI is, but it's not too bad.-The maps are semi-open world, with a set destination but often with multiple paths through the jungle or in vents. This design is the main thing that distinguished the game from other shooters at the time, and it's still cool today.-The graphics are very good for the time, particularly the map size and the foilage. Crytek are the masters of realistic video game foilage, and it shows here.Cons:-There's no quick-save, just checkpoints. You'll often find yourself running like a madman through the jungle in hopes of passing an autosave checkpoint. A game this hard needs to allow you to save more often, although any time you want probably isn't ideal either. There is a console command that lets you quick-save, which I used towards the end of the game when I was fed up. I recommend you decide at the beginning whether you will use it and then stick with your choice.-There's a bug that allows enemies to see you through tents and sometimes walls. I hear, there's a fan-patch online to fix  this, along with some graphical improvements. I honestly didn't notice the wall thing at all, and there's not very many tents in the game in the first place.-Finally, the plot is equivalent to a pretty average B-movie story. The voice-acting is somewhat dubious, and the main character, though fairly memorable, doesn't seem to enjoy anything at all.-Multiplayer is dead and almost certainly isn't coming back.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												Graphics are lovely with a real tropical feel to the game and a small amount of awe as you realise you can go anywhere on the maps, which are sometimes HUGE, Objectives are well paced and not confusing. There's no wandering around wondering what to do next.The enemy AI is very good, especially considering the open nature of the game, often they will try to out-flank your position or simply get behind cover so you must then flush them out leading to some pretty tense moments. However, it's not perfect, sometimes you will see the bad guys rooted to the spot for an easy kill or they simply charge your well hidden position and it's a turkey shoot. If anything, the flaws in AI make the game easier which is preferable to the opposite situation!The weapons are beautiful: a mix of real and futuristic improvements. Ammo is never really a problem (well, with the exception of the Sniper rifle bullets and the RPG loads when they would really tip the balance in your favour) and, most importantly, the damage they inflict is balanced: both enemies and player go down with about the same amount of damage. Where the game falls down is near the end when a couple of pointless nonsensical plot-twists ruin the story. The game 'ends' three times, with some ill-thought through extra levels tagged on each time.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												Far Cry has changed considerably as a series, most apparent when looking back at the first instalment, you might not even like this title even if you're a fan of subsequent Far Cry games, it's simply not the same. On it's own Far Cry has aged, and that's incontestable. Clear examples of ageing include the AI acting incomprehensibly at times, the graphics that haven't held up well, and probably the worst part of the entire game; the utterly predictable, rather cliché story that you're unlikely to get invested in.On a lighter note, gameplay has held up extremely well in my opinion, the gun-play was well implemented with a variety of weaponry to use, the levels are large enough and well laid out for facilitating various approaches to objectives whilst still being linear as a whole. As I said, just because you liked Far Cry's sequels won't necessarily mean you'll enjoy this so I'd recommend looking at some videos before you consider purchasing.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2014
												Unlike most games the bad guys in Far Cry really do have a mind of their own so its not just a case of running through and popping the odd enemy here and there, the mercenaries in this game are highly clued up and will detect you whether you move slowly, take cover or simply make them paranoid, you will not get past these guys easily.The best description for Far Cry would be "a game that received hype, but lived up to every last damn word of it".It delivers on all fronts: graphics, story, and especially gameplay. The only downside is that those with lower end machines are going to have to drop their graphics and resolution down quite a bit to achieve an acceptable frame rate.If you want a thrilling single-player FPS with the best looking graphics to date, then FarCry is for you.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 11, 2016
												Far Cry 1 is definitely on my list of top 5 favorite shooters of all time. Graphics still look amazing even up to today's standards. This was the first PC game I ever played. It started my entire PC gaming career, and for that reason I have to give this game extra credit. Far Cry brings back a lot of memories and nostalgia when I hear the ambience and environment of the jungle. What I've always loved most about this game is the sound and "feel" of the guns. I've played a lot of FPS in my time, but Far Cry has a way of making each and every weapon equally satisfying and fun to use. The physics are really well done. The hit detection makes your kills feel very satisfying while shooting at the island's mercenaries. This is my main game that I can always fall back on even to this day no matter how old it is.This game will challenge you. The AI are tough. If you're new to this game then it is no walk in the park. The "Medium" difficulty alone was rough my first time around. I still have my retail copy of this game and with years of experience I've improved a lot and have managed to move on to higher difficulty levels in campaign. This game blends in the role of stealth and action. Most scenarios require you to think of different tactics in order to take out each and every enemy one by one instead of the typical "run and gun" shooter. Adding new singleplayer Mods and Maps will greatly enhance the fun of this game. You just have to know where to put these files in the FarCry directory because this game doesn't support Steam Workshop unfortunately. There are also map editing tools you can download to create your own single player levels.The sequels to Far Cry are completely different compared to this one. Story wise and gameplay wise. I'll always prefer the original Far Cry over the newer ones any day. This is the real Far Cry experience. To me what has always been disappointing is how the sequels do not continue the story of the main character, Jack Carver. He is without question the true protagonist to Far Cry above any of the new playable characters in the sequels.Every FPS veteran should know of this game and played it before at least once. If you haven't, I highly recommend buying it. Crytek develops some of the best games of all time, such as the Crysis series, and Ryse: Son of Rome. Aside from that, it's too bad Crytek abandoned Far Cry and didn't develop the sequels.I wouldn't feel too skeptical about some of the negative reviews. Do not hesitate to buy this classic. Highly recommend. 10/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												Wow It is mindblowing...I actually just wanted to test the performance but i was so immersed in the game i could not let go for a full day. If you're looking for an excellent game and don't mind the graphics too much then you'Re right here. The graphics are actually not that bad but now this game is getting 10 years old and compared to other titles of this age and now it offers a lot.1.You can drive anything a buggy or jeep, that will allow to shoot during driving. Also you can choose between a rubber boat, speed boat with rocket launcher, hang glider or big truck. This things jump, drift, get wrecked and accelarate differently.2.Moving like in not many other shooters. This one offers what battlefield 3 does: sprint, prone, jump, crouch, lean left and right. As well as making different noise levels for the enemy and beeing more or less easy to spot.3.Shooting at it's best with realistic weapon recoil, holding breath for shooting. crouching and proning affects accuracy significantly, as well as running. 4. No line shooter. You can engage in 3 different walkways most times and don't need to kill more than 50% of the enemies to get through. I had so much fun attacking the enemy in the back or even just melee them. No matter if you like to sniper around, avoid stress or just blast the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of the situation. If you're good then it will work and if not then you will be restarted at the last quick save.5. Not open world nut action bubbles with nice details and long distances before reload. Everything stays on the map except corpses. if you forgot to pick up more ammo? No problem you can run back until the start of the level and it is still there altogether with those cars you've blown up and the huts you destroyed.6. Intelligent AI. Not the usual noobs you encounter in some new shooters. They fall back take cover and engage you from different sides. No AI actually stands still once they noticed you. None of them spawns behind or in front of you. They just come from any corner of this map where you forgot to look for them.If you are defensive and slow they approach you early and thus you won't face later so much. Vise versa for the heatheaded attacker.7. The Physics are awesome. All things are ragdolling around and the creators have given you awesome tools of destruction. Blow up a tank to smash the enemies with the wooden planks flying around or hit them with a rolling barrel. Knock them over with cars or use mortars and machines guns to get rid of them. Everything follows the laws of physics very nicely. Except boxes won't break from bullets and enemies can see you through fabrics, which are not bullet proof. Never the less no one glitches through walls (except the hands at the doors, but that's okay)I would say it earns a 9 out of 10 :)

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
PROS:+ fun & challenging gameplay+ cool vehicles+ choice of weapons and explosives+ no auto-heal (medkits only)+ vast enviroments of tropical islands+ enemy AI+ long gameplay time+ look and behaviour of the mutants+ no uPlayCONS:- nobody is playing multiplayer- couple of a bit linear indoor levels- INSANELY difficulty in some parts- voice acting is strange sometimes- ridiculously high number of HP of the mutantsComment:Got this game from a friend who switched to consoles and did not need PC games anymore. That was over 10 years ago and I am happy to say this game was great. Altohugh back then it was VERY graphically challenging for many PCs it was well optimized and so I could play it too. I quickly realized what a gem it is in how fluid the combat is....and how merciless the fights are. You see I played on Realistic, the hardest difficulty, because my brain was dumb and I thought realistic meant more simulation-like. Nope. It means the game is HARD up until the point the mutants appear ... then it is INSANELY difficult. But yet...somehow it was still fun for me. While taking out mercenaries is doable (a headshot kills everyone) the monster mutants needed a lot more bullet persuasion to go down. Except for the difficulty this game is great in vehicular combat - helicopters, boats, cars, trucks ... and you can even ride a rogalo! Graphics are nice, even today. The story is a bit bland but not bad, just simple - save girl, fight bad guys and then defeat monsters. Playtime here does not tell you how MANY MANY hours I spent trying to beat it on Realistic. But it does say something about how good it was when now, 10+ years later when my discs no longer work, I still went and bought it. If you can overlook (or enjoy) the difficulty and linearity of some parts then I can recommend this for you, it's loads of fun!

content:
Posted: January 27
												A very fun action game. The game is semi-linear with 20 levels, but there are often multiple paths and multiple viable strategies. The fps combat itself works well, and the game also has a decently realistic stealth system. The game autosaves pretty often at certain points so dying isn't annoying, which is good because you will die a lot (and sometimes for dumb reasons like an enemy somehow getting 5 headshots in a row). I'd recommend playing your first game on easy difficulty since the last few levels can be really hard.

number of helpful: 21 of 38 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
												Unfortunately the steam version ships with the infamous 1.4 patch which breaks the A.I making them much harder than they originally was;  and this game is pretty hard compared to newer Far Cry games and this makes the game alot less fun and makes stealth nearly impossible, heck it makes certain sections of the game nearly impossible since the A.I can shoot at you with high accuracy at long distances, even through walls with high accuracy too. In order to play the game without the AI super soldiers, you need the unofficial patchs or somehow downgrade to patch 1.3Now, I remember playing this back in 2004 and thought it was originally a good game, because back then-  Far Cry WAS a good game, but the standards have risen considerably over the years and this game shows cleary how low gamers standards was back then. Far Cry suffers from a huge amount of general issues which makes the game generally much harder than it really needs to be, such as troop placement being so specific to catch the player out, each mission as such is more about remembering where enemy mercs are; rather than planning a strategic attack- think of MOH; Sniper Alley style gameplay here, its frustrating and needless.Then to add further insult to injury, you have to put up with Carver being a complete tool in the gun accuracy department, his accuracy with weapons is excruciating bad, whilst the mercs have near perfect accuracy, this is why there are liberally scattered health packs and armor around because its nearly impossible not to take hits.   The accuracy is poor, imagine an artifical spray and pray - the gun cursor is just a 'basic' indicator where the bullets will go, not nessarily where you are pointing.  The gun sights offer slightly better accuracy but still, not good enough considering the accuracy of the mercs and traps. Even with some much needed mods like FCam; the game is still a huge chore to play and saving after every encounter with mercs is essential- forget using stealth tactics...if you want working stealth, install Far Cry 2 and skip this.As for the difficulty, there is honestly very little difference between easy and realistic difficultly - thats how hard this game is; realistic mode is just mostly for masochists who enjoy dying alot, or  who have played the game so much they have remembered the exact layout of the merc placements.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2015
 Far Cry   Gameplay and StoryIn Far Cry, you take control of protagonist Jack Carver, a former US Army Special Forces officer who now drives paying customers out on his charter boat. As he drives his new customer, Val Cortez, out to a mysterious Archipelago, his ship is blown up by the islands occupants, and he finds himself stranded and looking for this strange "Val"Far Cry is a first person action shooter, which is built off of CryEngine 1, so it has the basic gameplay template that comes with the engine. Far Cry is semi-open world, but there is always a main objective to follow, no side missions. There are multiple routes one can take to get to certain destinations as well.Click here to see all weapons used in-game[www.imfdb.org]Sadly, this game has no other features besides it's linear story mode and multiplayer, which is mostly dead.  I give this game an 8 out of 10, because while gameplay was fun and iconic, the dialogue and story were like a bad Tom Cruise/Nicolas Cage movieThanks for reading this review,Wolfie

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												Far Cry is very clearly an old game. The AI is stupid and glitchy, the enemies can see you from a mile away and shoot you with pinpoint accuracy through walls, and the poor graphics and cheesy action lines will make you realize how far video games have come. That being said, I had so much fun playing through this game. From the enemies that yell "are you alright?!" as you headshot them to your character's nonchalant reaction to the suicide missions he's sent on, this game had me in stitches, and at some points, it's extremely difficult to get through the missions (whether you try and stealth your way through or go in guns blazing). 8.5/10 will play the next 2 and maybe even buy the 4th one when it comes out. Have fun playing!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												Date of review: 07.10.2014Platform: PC Specifications: Released in back in 2004, Far Cry revolutionized the FPS genre with never before seen graphics and a huge "open" map which countless possibilities... no wonder many regarded it as the best FPS since Half Life. But that was a long time ago, can Far Cry still deliver after 10 years? Yes it can.Story:You are Jack Carver, a former US Special Forces soldier who now runs freelance boat charter services in the Pacific. You are employed by Valerie Constantine to take her to a mysterious island once occupied by the Japanese during the second world war, claiming to study its little-known ruins. Shortly after Valerie goes ashore your boat is attacked (and destroyed), and you barely manage to escape, finding yourself alone without any equipment on an island no one really knows about...Far Cry was never loved for having an extraordinary story, but the plot is solid enough and it doesn't lack twists and turns, keeping the player interested. It also mixes realism with sci-fi quite well and the transition from the realistic jungle warfare to the... well more sci-fi stuff is well paced.7/10 Visuals:While Far Cry can obviously not  keep up with today's graphics, maxed out I still wouldn't call it an ugly game. Sure, it's outdated, but it can still surprise you sometimes with the beautiful tropical setting. The vegetation and water still look good and the draw distance is surprisingly long making the game pleasant to play in the open environment. Interiors however do show heavy signs of aging. Good news is that you will be able to play on ultra settings without any problems on even low end machines nowadays.Once it might have been 10/10 today I will give it 6/10Gameplay:I was absolutely surprised on how much I enjoyed the gameplay of Far Cry, which blends some of the old school FPS elements like hitpoints and medpacks, armor, etc. with some of the more modern game elements like the huge open world, vehicles, stealth mechanics (especially useful in the jungle), etc. providing a multitude of ways to complete a given objective with a surprisingly competent AI. Also, while it is definitely an arcadeish shooter it will require a decent amount of planing and tactics because Far Cry is actually a hard game, especially towards the end. It might sound funny but Far Cry is a refreshing experience compared to most of today's shooters.10/10Sound:In terms of music and sound effects Far Cry is solid again. You won't remember the soundtrack for days, and the voice acting is sometimes poor, but the ambient sounds were quite good, further improving the immersion in the jungle fights.8/10Replay value:While the plot is linear and there aren't any choices which would affect the outcome, the gameplay provides countless ways to approach and deal with your objective, making the game worth several play troughs.8/10Conclusion:Far Cry might have once stood out primarily because of its visuals, but today is worth playing because of its challenging and fun gameplay. I do consider it one of the "must play" shooters out there and I definitely recommend it.8/10Test system specifications: AMD FX-8350 (OC @ 4.6 GHz); 8 GB DDR3 RAM @ 1866 MHz; AMD Radeon R9 280X (AMD Catalyst 14.4), Windows 7 64 Bit Ultimate.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												2004 was a great year in PC gaming, and while many regard Half-Life 2 as the brightest star of that great year, I'd still rank Far Cry on top of that. The game was a masterpiece in engine technology, and features some of the most interesting level design in FPS gaming. The weapons and the feeling of power they transfer to the hands of the gamer is of such a caliber (pun intended) that still hasn't been toppled by any game since. The Desert Eagle and M4 in Far Cry are quite simply the most enjoyable weapons in gaming.The game doesn't come without flaws though. The game suffers from the 'Crytek disease', namely, that a large part of the game is considerably worse after the introduction of superhuman enemies. In Crysis, it was the blue alien scum, which singlehandedly reduced the game to a bullet-spamming festival of bright lights, taking away all the interesting gameplay features. In Far Cry, it is the trigens. That being said, I'd rather battle trigens over aliens any day, but shooting loud-mouthed mercs is still way more fun.If you are interested in playing this masterpiece, by all means, play it with the FCAM 1.99 mod. It improves graphics, add more features and fixes bugs.
