content:
Posted: February 20, 2016
												I'm not a big FPS fan but I really enjoyed this game. Got it cheap and had many hours of fun. I would the describe the levels as sandbox-corridors. The levels overall were fairly linear, but most levels had breathing room and were wide open for experimentation with the ways you could approach combat. There are plenty of opportunities for vehicle/boat-based combat, but I found navigating the vehicles too cumbersome to really enjoy driving and shooting at the same time (especially the land vehicles). Played on Medium difficulty and it was definitively challenging. The game sometimes seems to steer you towards a stealth-based approach, but I didn't see any real mechanics to actually support stealth. Enemies could spot you really easily in thick brush or when you're far away, hear you even when you're approaching in crouch. and were ridiculously accurate when firing. Plus, you only carry a machete if you sacrifice a weapon spot. There really should've been a dedicated knife button or slot. So usually I would tag as many combatants as I could from afar with the binoculars, pick off the closest enemies or the most dangerous ones with available sniper ammo, rockets and grenades, and then charge in to mop up with the shotgun or machine guns. The game does a great job of slyly adding better weapons as the levels progress, so you never get too bored if you're paying attention and trying new guns. Used the TILDE key constantly to save the game via console. The auto-save spots were too infrequent.I enjoyed the enemy variety. You start off fighting vanilla mercenaries, and the game introduces different enemies and varieties throughout. Fun addition to game was that one group of enemies was constantly fighting another, and they'd only pause battle so both could attack you. Levels that included three-way combat were great. The story and characters are goofy fun. The way the game's plot reveals itself slowly over the 20-ish levels was well done, and maybe I'm dense but there was a twist near the end I didn't see coming. I was pleasantly surprised. The voice acting was hit and miss, but I thought the voice actor for Doyle the scientist did a great job, which is vital since he essentially narrates the game.Played 30+ hours, experienced zero crashes or noticeable bugs. Very stable game. Graphics were great for a game this old, and I really enjoyed the overall look of the island/sea setting. Crytek's specialty is advanced graphics and its reputation is well earned here.Give this game a chance if you haven't already, it's great fun. It's also a lengthy game so it's a great value proposition.

												I played this game way back when it first came out. My Dad bought it for himself and I played it after him. I absolutely love the game. Although I haven't played Far Cry 2, the rest of them that came after this one are boring. Sorry to anyone who thinks otherwise, but the original is, by far, the best in the series. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												"Far Cry" is arguably the toughest FPS I've ever played.Even on a completely subjective terms, I'm openly admitting that my review here is far from being a valid measure stick for how the game truly feels in the hands of an average FPS gamer as the RPG genre is what I usually prefer the most. That being said, my favorite shooting games until now were still those so-called "old schools" like "Return to Castle Wolfenstein", "Soldier of Fortune" and "Vietcong".Nonetheless, "Far Cry" is the game that doesn't allow you to simply run through your enemies and shoot them down mindlessly, but rather requires application of some real-life tactics and forces you to play like you truly are there on the islands as even a minor mistake could cost you most of your health bar. Enemies are tough, extremely intelligent and highly perceptive (especially on higher levels) to the point where you would almost consider it a bug - let's just say they can spot you from afar through dense undergrowth and even through tents... not to mention shoot you from miles away with like 90% precision. On the other hand, you're unable to tell where they are shooting at you from most of the times. However, that's not what makes this game hard in my opinion.Lack of manual "Save game" option is.It's quite frustrating to stealth around and take your enemies one by one for like half an hour... only to get shoot by some fodder your radar failed to spot (or even worse - your radar did spot him, but you were still unable to tell his exact location due to vegetation or whatnot). Briefly, distances between checkpoints on some levels seem painfully long.Despite that, this game can be passed without a single cheat, indeed. In order to do that, rely heavily on binoculars and cry vision goggles the whole time and you'll be fine. Oh, and make sure you don't miss to pick weapons like G36 or OICW because it's next to impossible to pass a couple of the last levels without them.Overall, story of this game seems pretty generic and predictable (with main character not being so particularly interesting); I'm giving it a solid 8/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												Awful voice acting, terrible graphics, still one of the better FPS games I have played. The game feels more of a giant maze where there are new types of baddies thrown at you at every corner, where as most FPS games I have played are very linear and its usually the same old bad guys. The game requires you to be thorough, but not that crazy where you are backtracking for five minutes. For it's time, it is pretty well put together. Being made in 2004, you might think oh the graphics aren't that great, but really when you think about it, this was in PS2/XBox/Gamecube era so graphics weren't that great for any game in this time. You can run in and gun or take the EXTREMELY SLOW approach and silently do in the goons, for the first half of the game. After the first half, the silent aproach is not imposible, but more of an incovenience when you have an arsenal of weapons to your disposal. Might I add that this game is longer than all of the other FPS games I have played and also TOUGH. It took me 15.7 hours (according to steam) to play through this game ONCE on normal difficulty. Pretty long for a FPS game, probably due to the fact that in 2004, developers were more focused on the main story of the game rather than the multiplayer aspect like the two titans, Call of Duty and Battlefield. If the game added up the total deaths i had, it would seem almost embaressing. Oh, and the dreaded 4x4 part. If you have played this game, you know what im talking about. F--- that part. If you havent played this game,  you can switch to the rocket launcher. Check the control options, that is all im telling you. People are saying the game is bugged, it is true, mildly. the guards can shoot through the tents accurately. You dont come by the tents very often but the bug driives people away because it is so close to the beginning of the game. Gameplay, I give this a solid 9/10. Replay value I give it a 6.5/10. This is due to the fact that the only other time you will probably want to pick this game up again is when you are feeling notalgic.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
												!!! SPOILERS !!!Awesome game, especially the stealth aspect is very fun to play. The AI. is very glitchy at times, unfortunately, but other than that, the gameplay is good.One of the disadvantages the game has is the Checkpoint save system, which unnecessarily increases the difficulty by a huge amount at some points As you progress through the game you follow a (very open, yet) linear path to various objectives that are pointed out on the map. At various keypoints, for example behind a base, a yards down the road, or at a roadblock the enemy put up. These are usually few and far between, *especially* in later levels of the game. As you activate the checkpoint by walking into it, instead of completing an objective (like killing the soldiers guarding the base (roadblock), it can happen that you accidentally save while on very low health. With a normal Save/Load system you would just reload an earlier checkpoint and try again to complete the section at higher health/armor, but this waqy you have to completely scavenge the base and all the surroundings for ammo and health/armor to at least have a chance at progressing through the game, as you WILL die very quickly, depending on your difficulty.Apart from the save system, another flaw of the game is the steep difficulty curve. At one point in the game you will encounter so-called Trigens, mutated apes that will jump at you and can usually kill you in just under a few hits.These can make it extremely hard to survive against other human enemies, just because they reduce you to such low health.Another frustrating enemy appears much further in the plot: Giant mutants. With rocket launchers. That detect you from like 200m away. Afggdfgfdgdgsg.These are so frustrating to kill, as they usually take like a million hits to kill, draining your ammo count (one time, I had to resort to grenades, as all my guns were completely out of ammo!)Overall, the levels are well designed, though, and the rest of the gameplay makes up for those annoying details.If I had to rate the game, I would give it an 8/10. 9/10 if the Save system was improved out of the box, that means more checkpoints and better placement of them, or a Quicksave/Quickload system, like in many other games.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
												Far Cry was one of this games which I remember playing as a child. So I bought it on Steam and don´t regret it.Short:+Good gunplay, weapons feel strong.+Tactic matters in taking out enemys.+Good mix between linear and open world sections.+Thinking outside the box will reward you.+It´s looking pretty good for a 2004 game.+/- ITS HARD AS♥♥♥♥♥♥+/- Story is not really deep, but still cheesy enough to entertain me.-AI sometimes goes full Cyborg-mode and see you through vegetation and geometry.-Render distance is pretty low, AI will often attack you outside your watchable space. Using scopes is the only solution.-At some points, enemy placement is simply unfair.-I got stuck in geometries a couple of times, seems like just bad collider.Long:Far Cry is one of the last true "old-school" games which means it is designed to be hard. If you want an easy shooter to kill some time, this is the wrong game for sure. To say it lightly you WILL die, a lot. For starters I recommend to play your first run on "easy", even for hardcore shooter-fans. Because every difficulty setting has an invisible +1 on it, what I mean is: easy is normal, normal is hard, hard is super hard etc. You get the point.That said the game feels very good, the gunplay is strong, the AI is somewhat intelligent and tries to actively get you with a variety of tactics. Also the graphics are okay (especially for a 2004 game) and exploring feels rewarding. Hidden armorys, shortcuts and pathways are waiting in nearly every level for attentive players to be found.On the other hand Far Cry suffers from two major flaws: The first is the fact that the render distance is very low, so what happens is that enemys WILL attack you outside your see-able area. You have to get closer or use scoped weapons to even see them. That said the enemys are unbelievable strong, especially when they somewhat go full ARMA 2 cyborg-mode and see you through obstacles and hit you with every shot at insanely distances.The second flaw are bad colliders. I got stuck several times in different levels and sections, which got me killed and that’s frustrating.Well every other aspect is not worth mentioning, the music is okay, story is not great but cheesy which makes it okay.So I would say:Gameplay:        5*Graphic:            4*Music&Sound:  3*Story:                3*Overall 8/10 Points, I had fun and that is a good sign.

												The graphics still hold surprisingly well, and I am still amazed at how immersive the island setting can be.  Despite beign set in a tropical island similar to Crysis and Far Cry 2, Far Cry manages to create its own mood.  Even if sometimes bordering on action movie, there is still an unnerving sense surrounding the whole experience.  You are both the prey and predator, picking enemies one by one or when caught, running for your life and likely having to restart your checkpoint due to the game's relentless and super accurate AI.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												One of the best looking games ever made. Sound effects are amazing as well, dialogue is cheesy but fits the theme of the game. Plenty of enemy variety, although some are overpowered with being able to move too fast and having impossibly precise aim. Stealth is encouraged with plenty of ways to hide and be silent when killing. Going in gung ho usually does not work due to the overwhelming number of enemies that can be in the area. Long campaign, although it does get repetitive after a while and rewards you with a sudden and anticlimatic ending. Boss fights are challenging but not profoundly epic. Vehicles are fun to use and control fairly well. It can be a pain having to trouble long distances without a vehicle, which may happen from time to time. Use the console for saving because the checkpoints are way too far apart. The franchise has come a long way but if you're interested in its roots like I was it is a fun adventure through the jungle. 8.0/10

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												Truly a classic.  Graphics are respectable, especially considering this came out in 2004.  I'm sure this game was melting rigs back then.Story isn't half bad.  Dialogue is cheesy though.Good variety of weapons and a great soundtrack.But...The difficulty.  I've never died so much.  The lack of a save besides autosave adds to the difficulty, and this game is truly difficult.  On realistic, I would almost advise taking blood pressure medication since it literally is die, repeat, die, repeat, die, repeat (you're like tom cruise in edge of tomorrow). There was maybe like two sections between autosaves where I did not die multiple times throughout the entire game.  AI not only has x-ray vision, but can headshot you from 200m away with a pistol through walls/tents/bunkers.  Driving vehicles will also give you cancer.Despite all that though, it's still quite enjoyable.  It's a real challenge unlike many current games which feel dumbed down.Highly recommended.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
This game still looks beautifull!Even though this game is over 10 years old, it still looks beautiful. The graphics is actually so good, that is outshines some games released a decade later. But, there is always a butt! It takes too long before the story begins, and when it does, it is not very good. The A.I. is very stupid, and clearly programmed to not see you while you are moving in the vegetation. Other than that, they have no problems spotting you trough tents, bunkers and walls. They are also able to spot you further away than you can see, so you will have to use the binoculars to see who is shooting at you. I do not get the part with the mutants, it just feels weird. Other than that the game is pretty entertaining. The levels are a mix between “open world” (semi-open world with different paths that leading to the same goal) and linear. The game mechanics are good, which makes the game enjoyable. The hitboxes are good for a game this old, and you are rewarded for steady aim. The variation in weapons is not great, but it is good enough (should have been more weapons with silencer).All in all this is a alright game and I think it deserves a score of 6,5/10. This is a good buy, if you can get it for a discounted price, or in a bundle.Weapon of choice: Mouse and keyboardDifficulty: ChallengingResolution: 1920x1080Graphics: All max

content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
												This game left an important legacy, I'll give it that. It was one of the better-in-class during its day, but ultimately it hasn't stood the test of time. It's not a bad game, but it's not great either. I understand the "cult" following - it was and still is a beautiful game in its own right, the levels are quite large and sprawling, it's got tons of content, and it has a 90s pulp craziness about it.Honestly though, it's just not a well designed game. The movement is too sluggish for the level sizes, vehicles handle fairly bad, the ai are really stupid but equipped with incredible vision and aim, and it's unjustifiably difficult at times. I started to wonder why it was such a mess until I realized it was Crytek's first game. Ubisoft Montreal has improved the series dramatically, lack of innovation in the present titles aside. If you're coming from Far Cry 3-4 or even Far Cry 2, this game is completely different aside from some general level design motifs.Don't get me wrong, It's absolutely worth the current 10 dollar asking price and it can be quite a lot of fun, but do yourself a favor (if you haven't already played this) and dont treat it as a game to be played through to completion. It's not worth your time and energy. Just treat it as a fun FPS sandbox to play around in. Once the mutants show up it all goes down hill pretty fast (actually somewhat slowly since god damn, this game seems long). There are some mods to check out too, so if the free form open-ish world gameplay wasn't enough, theres that.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												As a fan of retro games, I grabbed this game on sale since friends said it was a good game. That nails it: it WAS a good game back in the days. But first off, the good things: This game was simple, dumb fun most of the times. Let me tell you why. Most importantly, shooting in this game is really fun since you get a nice load of guns, binoculars and a working stealth system. Pretty well done for a game of this age. There's some vehicles you can drive which is kinda fun, too. Your enemies aren't entirely stupid either and there's a whole lot of different enemy types, adding enough variety to keep you entertained.The story is ridiculously dumb and cliché (yeah, this is a good thing IMO). The typical random guy who turns out to be a born killing machine and badass (you), the "hot" sidekick babe (unfortunately not as hot as the developers think she is) and of course, the ultimate antagonist: The German, crazy, narcissistic and ubermensch-creating Doctor Krieger. The plot is so dumb it's actually funny, so I guess it's alright as it is. Whoever buys this game can't possibly be expecting a deep story anyway, right?Now to the bad things. This game is old, and that means its mechanics are not too well balanced and can FRUSTRATING. So if you are not the patient type, just forget this game. I'll give you some reasons as to why it gets so frustrating sometimes. First off, it doesn't have a health regenerating mechanic like most new shooters have. That means, you often get stuck with low health in very hard situations, making those even harder. You need armor pickups and health packs and both kinds are not being distributed in a regular order. Sometimes, you literally swim in pickups, sometimes, you don't get even a single one for what feels like five minutes of trying to survive literal rocket rains.Oh, yeah. Second: ROCKETS. This is a game mechanic extremely frustrating since you cannot dodge them in certain situations and NPC's are too dumb to realize when the rocket is going to harm THEM as well so they just stay trigger happy even in meelee range. Also, there's a lot of enemy types using rockets, so it happens a lot.Third: Enemies act pretty normal in close to medium range. At long range, they become ♥♥♥♥ING EAGLE EYED MLG SNIPERS. Okay, maybe not this bad, but still, enemies spot you from veeery far away and start shooting, resulting in you losing health to an enemy you cant even see with your bare eyes. Especially annoying if these enemies happen to have friggin' rockets with them.Fourth: Game design. While this game has decent design (meaning having you knowing what to do, where to go and not being unfair) at most points, SOMETIMES IT ABSOLUTELY DOESN'T. While that is pretty common for old games, that doesn't really make it better. So be ready to face fights you will have to do at least ten times to figure out which kind of game mechanic or AI flaws you might abuse to actually win them (that's what I meant by patience).If all that still doesn't bother you too much and you're okay with older graphics, wait for a sale and pick it up. It's a nice little shooter when you're bored and also the first Far Cry game, paving the way for the Crysis series and the newer Far Cry games. It's interesting to see how incredibly similiar the gameplay of Far Cry 1 was to its successors. Still, this is a very old game suffering from typical design flaws. Remember to be patient with it.Thanks for reading and enjoy the game if you buy it. ;)

												Classic FPS shooter game in every traditional sense of the word.Nothing really complicated in the way of having to use any special powersand abilities.No nanosuit like in Crysis to go invisible and increase your strength.No teammates to help you out when going gets tough.It's just you and your ability to outshoot and outrun your opponents.Or try to sneak past them.Excellent graphics for it's time but obviously outdated now.Also what makes this game really worth having is the many custom modsand maps that are available to download for it.If you like the older action games like SOF,Delta Force series etc. thenthis game should be on your wanted list.In addition to human enemies there is an extra challenge in the form ofmonsters created as a result of a mad scientists genetic experiments.And these creatures are tougher than the mercenaries.So beware and have fun shooting your enemies and getting killed inreturn.Make sure your character obtains a good life insurance policy becausechances are his lifespan will be short which may be either bad or blessingfor his beneficiaries.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												Although the sequels to this game usually include elements of sandbox, RPG, and open world, the first game in the series deviates largely from its sequels. It has more a focus on level design and campaign than the others. It has has elements of sci-fi and corny golden-age FPS. What I'm trying to say is, don't buy this game expecting it to be ANYTHING like Far Cry 2, 3 or 4!In its own right it is a good game. It establishes a unique form of gameplay that many of its sequels use, and other games have expanded upon. It isn't "bang-bang" and hide behind a rock sort of strategy, the fighting in this game will require you to think, plan, and execute with extreme efficiency. If you don't play by the game with strategy, you will find yourself dying countless times. Trust me, I played the game on easy, and I still haven't got past the last level!Although this is a great game, it hasn't aged so well. The textures aren't so great, and the character models are dated. However, the beautiful enviroments of the island have aged quite nicely. If you come to this game looking for deep, meaningful, Bioshock-like dialogue; you're going to be disappointed. This game never takes itself seriously for a second and that includes dialogue. Jack is your typical all-american hero, Val is your typical matter-of-fact reporter, and the mercs you fight are just as corny, saying lines such as "I've got your number!" or, "I'm gonna open a can of whip♥♥♥♥♥on you!"I find that this is kind of like a good predator video game, great action, over-the-top voice acting and dialogue, and the best gameplay you'll get. This game is great, too bad it hasn't aged well.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
												Classic FPS shooter game in every traditional sense of the word.Nothing really complicated in the way of having to use any special powersand abilities.No nanosuit like in Crysis to go invisible and increase your strength.No teammates to help you out when going gets tough.It's just you and your ability to outshoot and outrun your opponents.Or try to sneak past them.Excellent graphics for it's time but obviously outdated now.Also what makes this game really worth having is the many custom modsand maps that are available to download for it.If you like the older action games like SOF,Delta Force series etc. thenthis game should be on your wanted list.In addition to human enemies there is an extra challenge in the form ofmonsters created as a result of a mad scientists genetic experiments.And these creatures are tougher than the mercenaries.So beware and have fun shooting your enemies and getting killed inreturn.Make sure your character obtains a good life insurance policy becausechances are his lifespan will be short which may be either bad or blessingfor his beneficiaries.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												Probably the most difficult FPS I've ever played. But it's also probably one of the better FPS games I've experienced because it never really felt repetitive to me, unlike other games of the same genre. You need to adopt a methodical apporach, be wary of your surroundings, and be a crack shot in order to progress through each level. You can't just dive in and spray like scarface every single time. That's not gonna cut it in this one. I'd recommend buying on discount due to some bugs and (from what I heard) multiplayer being dead. But if you're an avid FPS player, this is a goodie to have with 20 levels,12-15 hours of gameplay, and the open world. Oh,and whoever designed the last level in this game is a sadist.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												Trully, this game takes the FPS genre, and makes it so you have to use your brain while playing it. It took me almost a year to beat it because it was so hard.  I kept taking breaks because the game created so much stress but for a shooter in 2004, its not that bad.  If you get mad about video games easily DON'T play this Far Cry.  Its a classic shooter campaign, its not like the Far Cry's we know and love, but its part of the franchise, and its not all bad.  Bottom line its worth playing for patience skills(It will jam those skills into you), and the story is still good.  So if you like a challenging game play Far Cry Classic.  I got it for $2.50 during the steam christmas sale 2014.  If you dont like hard games, save your sanity and dont even bother.  Thank you for your time.-A Far Cry Fan

content:
Posted: December 11, 2015
												Had not ever played far cry 1, and taking the year released into consideration this is a game well worth the 10 bucks. You can see where they made improvements as the series went on but the maps are pretty large. Still feels like its open world fsp almost. The aiming is a bit awkward, some AI detect you pretty easy but some of the AI should get some credit the meter did not rise until they actually saw me. Some must of used the force to detect my movements. For map size I would argue it rivals the later Far crys and fallouts though it is very empty/repetitive map and they did add a lot more later on. The story thus far is kinda cheesy. The graphics on max look comparable to late ps2 early ps3 graphics id say. I've heard there are enhacements which I am just using the stock version so with those who knows what kind of graphics you could get. So yeah of course nothing is going to make you go wow but the game doesn't quite feel 11 years old. One interesting note I'd like to make the game comes with an option to add mods on and switch between the modded version and original version on the main menu which in my opinion is awesome. Of course you have to find the mods yourself but still.If you haven't played the game and like open world fps games then this is a good idea to play!

content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
												A short story  about this game. before i do the review. First thing i remeber was i watched my friends brother play this game back in elmentary school , when i was around 9 or 10 and so i might have played some very few minutes back then but i can`t remember. I remeber I bought this july 2009 along with cod 2 somewhere in Germany in a super market. I finished cod 2 i was probably one of few in my classes that played the orignal cod games and didnt start and jump on the bandwagon on either mw 1 or for the most part in my class mw 2. However i bought far cry 1 and got to the last part of the game and never managed to do it if i recall correctly , before i had to unistall it. So i decided to take with me my far cry cd to my small house for the holiday and try and play it again. Ofc my cd didnt work, but i had  luck that it was 75% of steam so to re buy it digital instead of using my old vista computer and burn my far cry cd to another cd , as i couldnt until i get home anyway , i decided why the hell i can now have this digitally. So now we are around 7 years later and i finally managed to completed this. So how does it hold up compared to then.  Well i recalled alot of the locations from when i played particaly the last location and some of the locations mid way trough the game eiter way:Good:- Gameplay, u can stealth some parts if you want to, you can plan your approach most of the times, and most of the levels has multiple solutions or multiple routes to take.- Good soundtrack- Great level desing- Great gunplay. - Its hard even on normalDecent : - Voice acting- Story , it would be on bad if this was anything but an fps , but you dont exept a fps do have good story and the story is actully pretty decentBad- Enemy line of sight can sometimes be bit weird but usually works just fine.Beside that not muchRating 9/10  One of my favorite fps along with cod 2, mw 1, medal of honor frontline, half life 1 and even far cry 2 ( yeah i  know i am one of the few who really liked it)   ( Deus ex if that counts to)Probably had more fun with this then far cry 3 too.Total play time if you excl my steam version i guess  around 25 hrs. I was far worse on fps 7 years ago then i am now. I rarely play fps these days but this one is recommend.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Although this game is a bit old, if you adjust the video settings, you can get it looking pretty sharp. It's a bit like being in a dumb 1980's action movie. The characters are flat and the storyline if chock full of cliches. But that's the whole point. The sexism in this game is so off-the-wall that it goes beyond cringeworthy and into the realm of insightful. It feels like a glimpse into the writer's soul. Who hurt you, man?This is one of the most difficult shooters I've ever played. While you can reach most checkpoints by being careful and patient, it's still a bit much. The checkpoints are so far apart. Sometimes you have to beat impossible odds and you die just before reaching the checkpoint. About 2/3 through this game, I looked up a cheat that lets you save/load anywhere. That helped a bit but it was still incredibly difficult.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 17, 2015
												Its been a long time since I played an FPS game, so I thought why not give FarCry a try. I've never played a FarCry before , nor seen any playthroughs of it. So I went at this one blind and simply said it exceeded  my expectations. This is not a game that you raise your gun and run through without taking your share of fire. On the contrary you take fire and suffer multiple deaths througout the game. FarCry forces you to use tactics to survive.The AI can be brutal at times utilizing actual tactics to hunt you down and kill you. It is a common ocurocurrence to get cut down by a sniper , walk into an ambush , or get caught up in crossfire. Often times the mercs will distract you with a 3 man squad while the fourth member is creeping silently to flank and destroy you.You must use stealth , cover, and keep your *** down in the bush or you will certainly wind up dead. Throughout the game I would crawl  through the jungle to avoid contact as long as I could. Recon is a must in FarCry , if you go into an enemy camp unprepared you are dead. Even the best trained soldier dies if he is unprepared , so remember to recon and  take the best weapon synergies possible into the fight. You must learn to adapt as the batlle will shift from jungle to corridor frequently. FarCry forced me into a very slow methodical pace , and as such may not be for everyone. I really enjoyed playing FarCry and it renewed my interest in FPS games again. If you are the kind of gamer who enjoys a real challenge then I would highly recomend that you give FarCry a play. FarCry is filled with many interesting twists and as a result I never really knew when it was going to end. As I've said before "If you are not very careful you will die alot." Try not to get frustrated FarCry was intended to be difficult. If you should survive until the endgame hopefully you will have found FarCry a rewarding experience. I highly recommend FarCry to people who appreciate a challenge in an FPS.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												2004 was probably a great year for video games (Half Life 2, Halo 2, Fable , etc). Far Cry is one of those. This is the game that not only introduced the Cry Engine (famous for powering Crysis 2-3) but a start of one of the coolest FPS franchises in history. Far Cry is set in a mysterious set of islands in Micronesia (the Pacific). You play as Jack Carver, a former soldier that gets sent in to sabotage a research facility that is experimenting with mutated soldiers and animals by some evil scientist guy namd Krieger. The island levels are beautifully crafted. You can also swim, ride vehicles such as trucks and boats and collect new weapons. There's a pretty good variety in the game's arsenal.  The story for Far Cry however is basic and simple so don't expect anything special.But if you've played Far Cry 2-4 and want to try the game that started it all, you might be disappointed to find out that FC1 is actually linear, not open world. However, several levels feel wide enough to give you the illusion that you're exploring. The game is also increasingly difficult. I managed to finish this on medium difficulty for the first time but the last levels were so hard, I actually had to use godmode for cheats. There was just no way I was gonna finish it without that. And I already went through really hard levels without cheating in the first place. But despite that, I do recommend this. It's a great game but in retrospect, I am not sure if FC1 did anything considered revolutionary at the time.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												Far cry is an open world FPS, the game is 11 years old, but it still holds up, but its not all fine and dandy.You play as Jack Carver, a former special forces soldier who is hired by a woman named Val, investigating a strange island, all the sudden the boat is attacked and Jack is beign hunted down by mercs. i wont give to much spoilers because at the end of the game there is a HUGE plot twist. First lets talk GRAPHICS. For 2004, this game looks great, the water is the most impresive part of the game, yep the water. (I Think Half-Life 2 Looks Better) Gameplay is standard FPS shizz, you shoot things. the weapons are generic but some are kewl. the starting weapon is a deagle, and the first rifle you get is the generic M4 carbine, soon you get a sniper rifle, rocket launcher and other stuff, there is a upgraded version of the m4 that has a grenade launcher, but the 3 best weapons are the following, The Shotgun, fully auto-matic and takes out bad guys quickly at close range, the OICW, the best assault rifle, semi auto grenade launcher, and scoped. The most BAD♥♥♥♥♥weapon is the Negev, the FMG is op, you get it towards the end of the game. Now lets talk about the difficultyFAR CRY IS HARDEven on normal this game is difficult, but the biggest offender isTHERE ARE NO QUICKSAVESopen the console using the ~` key and type, \save_gamethat will quicksave, YOU WILL NEED IT SON."Hey! How Was That FPS Game With No Quicksaves? Said No One Ever" - gggmanlivesOverall Far cry is a great game, with fun gunplay, good graphics, i could recommend Far Cry, however the main issues are no quicksaving and the difficulty, i like a challenge, but that will trun off people. Final Score, 8/10

number of helpful: 15 of 29 people (52%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
												I need to start off my review saying this. This game is balls to the walls difficult for an FPS. It is not forgiving and I was basically only able to beat this game by using a save game cheat. And that is basically the only part of this game that makes it unreplayable. Too be honest I found the gunplay to be quite fun. It is lacking as the enemies are complete bullet sponges, taking in up to a full clip from your M16. Guns in this game are neat, but it does focus on assault rifles. Other than three of them there are only enough weapons to fill the status quota of different types of weapons. Lacking? Yes. But still fun as I said earlier. The story of this game is quite...stupid. Government genetic testing. Bored yet? It is definetly not the reason you will be playiing the game. And neither will its claim to be an open world game. Maybe I just played the game wrong somehow but I found the world to be quite linear, with largish levels to trudge through. I started playing this game about the same time I started playing Far Cry 3 and...I was dissapointed. Now I know what you are saying, that I shouldn't be comparing it to a newer game, but to call this game open world seems like a sin to me, and made me glad we have 3. Score: 6/10It is worth it on sale and if you want to see how the series began. Or if youre a hardcore bada** who can take on the world. If you can kill every enemy in this game on one playthrough you are the ultimate gamer.

												The game is still as fun as I remember it was 10 years ago. A classic FPS with a bit of a cheesy/cliche story that will test your abilities to plan ahead in battle (or spam quick save/reload)!Go buy it, if you're a fan of HARD shooters. Graphics are also pretty good, amazing for something that's 10 years old (at the time of writing)!Other pros include:- a semi-open world, you can explore all you want but you won't gain anything from it (at least I didn't find anything).- some pretty funny one liners from enemies at times, you  will  be that guy in the shirt, whose♥♥♥♥♥is surely grass by now. - a somewhat creepy/scary atmosphere at times.- overall hardness of the game. It's quite hard, mailny because the enemies have laser guided x-ray targeting that could even spot you if you were behind a brick wall on mars.- no uplay!!!"...the guy in the shirt!"/10

content:
Posted: November 13, 2016
												This thing came out in spring 2004 few months before Doom 3 and i guess that was the reason of D3 missed some portion of popularity... Of Course not everyone wants to deal with ugly demons somewhere in the a$$ of the hell when there is possibility to ride a motor boat/jeep around green and shiny tropical islands and be pleased by such beautiful water rendered by CryEngine. I can bet everything i have this game was the one who set the rulles for next gen 1st person shooters for at least next 3-4 years in 2004. And the only few things that this game missed we could saw in Project IGI such as gameplay balance/moments. Today i can't imagine what does "next gen" means b'cos every freaken 2nd B+ game called next gen... But back to 2004 FarCry 1 was true next gen game. With many attempts since 2004 I was walking through this game and at last "happy-ended" it one or two years ago on highest difficulty like I'm doing sometimes to get maximum satisfaction after finishing game to the end and after this stand up and say something like "Yes! I Did it!". This game was the 1st game where i've saw how enemy's IA working with some kind of virieties... how smooth ingame 3D graphics can be .... how to search and find the only 1 possible way to walk through a certain moments(highest difficulty) and how to learn to save game every freaken minute or less. Farcry 1 have common but aint bad story line in canons of action/thriller genre. Game is linear but still have some freedom/roam of movement b'cos it's big maps/levels. Multiplayer was also very fun and satisfiyng. I still remember those crazy jumps and kills on boats/jeeps across tropical islands that we can see now in modern Battlefield series...As year 2004 project 10/10.Sound/Voice/Music - 8/10. Graphics/Visuals - 10/10. Storyline - 8/10. Gameplay - 9/10.I would reccomend this game as common 1st shooter but one of the best 1st person shooters ever were released... to everyone. This game is strong part of history in PC Game industry. By the way... single player gameplay is not so dynamic as people can see in CoD series. So DO NOT expect nonstop action.-W-

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												As with Far Cry 2 and Far Cry 3 being out in the market, this game is hardly mentioned. Is it because Far Cry 3 literally beat down the others so nobody will try this game? or just because the game is very old. Not sure. Very fun when you have nothing to do and this will entertain you for a couple hours. Multiplayer is pretty much dead so I wouldn't even try to get onto that.When I downloaded this game, I launched it and I got a "Critcical Error"or "Critical Exception" Probably becuase I was playing on a Integrated-laptop. I easily fixed this by going to Far Cry Config and turning dynamic light to "HIGH" instead of "VERY HIGH" I guess it just took too much to handle for Intel HD Graphics.When I played this game on Intel HD Graphics (1000), it ran on mostly Very High settings with Shadows on Low. Ran around 50 fps average, so you shouldn't be worried about if you can run this game or not. This game is VERY VERY challenging to play even on MEDIUM difficulty, as it then goes all the way to Realistic, which I am not even going to BOTHER run. But definitely more challenging than Far Cry 2-3, and even other games to this day.8/10 Fun, Exciting, Challenging.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2016
												Maybe this game is an acquired taste.I haven't acquired it after 17 hours.Far Cry is difficult for the wrong reasons, in my opinion. I played it on medium, with adaptive AI turned off (maybe that was my mistake).Enemies will shoot accurately at you before you can even see them (at max render distance).Enemies with rocket weapons will shoot your face from 6 feet away; they'll be fine, and you'll be at half health.Enemies fighting each other will switch targets to you, even if you're just passing by.As you progress through the game, ambushes become more and more frequent.The control scheme is good, although driving is a little wonky.The story is decent, but it's hard to enjoy when you fight the same set of enemies 7 times in a row.Graphics are dated (obviously), but not distracting.I wanted to like Far Cry - the feel of it worked really well. You're not some glorious hero, saving the world. You're a guy, killing lots of people on an island because you don't want them to kill you.The guns, the vehicles, the enemies and sneaking around all felt right, strengthening the game's atmosphere.I wanted to like Far Cry. It just seemed to hate me.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												Ok, before people asking why I make a review to a game in which I have 0 hours...I played this already hundreds of hours I guess. Not on Steam and with mods. FCAM mostly.Back when I played it, it wasnt even on Steam and I played one of the first proper 64Bit games, with patch.You are Jack Carver and you are on a trip to a island.Unexptected your companion disappears and you get attacked by mercs. You have to escape onto the island.You are swimming and a grenade explosion underwater throws you into a tunnel and you get unconscious.You wake up in a old sewer and need to escape. You fast meet a guy called Doyle which seems to want to help you.He gives you cordinates and tips how to survive and what to do. So your trip over the big island starts.The gameplay is a classical FPS shooter. Located in a openworld tropical island most of the time. You have several wespons like a knife, pistol, machine gun or sniper to fight against the enemies. You will meet many on your way over the island and the interesting is that they are quite inteligent, especially for old 2004 enemies. There also some sort of mutant enemies next to the typical mercs but those come later into the game. You also have some sort of spy glasses to mark enemies on your map marker or just check the situation. On your way you sometimes also can use cars. Thats pretty much it. Simple but extremely well made, especially for 2004.The engine is the CryEngine. Back in 2004 this was one of the best looking games out then and it really changed the way of FPS shooters. Well, notably together with HL2 which came out around the same time.Also this was the first game of a German developer named Crytek. Which is also known for the Crysis series.This game has nothing to do with the Ubisoft Far Cry games like 2,3,4. The only thing they have in common is that they are FPS. Dont make this mistake please!The graphics are extremely good for the time and even today it somewhat still looks good or decent at least.All graphic options you can imagine are ingame. There are even Render options ingame with that you can let the game for example look like a cartoon game! Rarely I seen such options in games! Far Cry turns into Borderlands. Also sound settings are extremely advanced! Extremely good and well made PC game. There is also a 64Bit patch available. You need to install it extra though. I personally recommend using the mod FCAM instead. Delivers pretty much the same graphical enhancements. On the top there are even more graphical improvements. This mod really pushes the engine to its real limit. Even my HD 5870 some years ago couldnt handle it on 60FPS on maxed settings, 1080p and 4xAA. For the fact that the game was like 6 years or more old this was astonishing. FCAM also adds proper ironisghts which work really good! Also it fixes many of the annoying bugs like enemies which can shoot through objects and hit you... FCAM is a must have! Even for first time players! Grab the latest 1.999 version on moddb guys!Positive:- Old but gold!- Pretty good PC game, technically speaking- Really good FPS experience- Challenging difficulty, good enemy AI- No regenerating health!- Great graphics with many options- Mod FCAM makes the game even better and makes it "perfect"- Crytek! Because yes!Negative:- Difficulty is high- Multiplayer is dead as of 2014. Gamespy is down but it was never played that much in MP anywayReplayability: HighRating: 9.5/10In my opinion this is totally one of the best games ever made.Rarely I played a game so often, especially after so many years. Definitely a big part of gaming history, especially on PC.Also mods like FCAM improve it so much!What are you waiting for? BUY IT!

												First things first... The graphics are amazing. For me, it's the first time that I played where you are in the tropics and can swim in the waters. Each level as you progress shows off a different part of the day. Morning, mid day, evening and night. The game play is straight forward, you also have an open range to wander but, it gets redundant at one point. Best to stay on track and enjoy the scenery either by running, driving, motorboating, and even by hang glider.Kill the bad guys, kill the monsters too, they can be scary at times, some of them move fast. You can use machine guns, sniper rifes, pistols and even throw rocks to create distractions. Typical FPS game and well what's differnt too is that your game difficulty depends on how you deal with the bad guys. Sometimes you have to use stealth to get by or face a barage of angry mercs.The game is worth playing. Check out any youtube videos on it. I have played this quite a few times already before it was on steam.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
												I was wondering how long it would take for me to find a game that was really not worth my time. Farcry made me cry, a lot. So let's get into this.Far Cry is not a game where the story was generally well thought out. They throw you onto an island "paradise" where your character, jack Carver, was vacationing. From there something random happens and you have to fight through mercenaries in order to get contact with scientist named Doyle. Your character immediately trusts Doyle for no reason and then proceeds to fight through random monkey mutants and mercenaries in order to rescue a woman I still know nothing about. In short the story doesn't really make sense and is full of plot holes. Often the characters do things blindly or through the power of male female attraction. If the three characters do know each other then it's not well established. The story feels barely stitched together and thus is easily the weakest part of the game. It simply doesn't make sense, less so than many call of duty campaigns. From a sound design perspective the game is fairly unremarkable. Be ready for weak audio cues and sound effects that don't really match the actions of the characters. When a main character gets shot in a bullet proof vest he will basically Wilhelm scream, the enemies shout the same five taunts at you. All the weapons have compressed unrealistic sound effects and generally speaking the OST seems to be the same five tracks. If it isn't, then they all sound the exact same. This game did not impress in the sound department. The game mechanics are frankly broken. I've seen alot about this actually and it seems this is the result of a bad patch but it still made the game barely playable. Only a few of the guns actually are usable. The AI is ridiculous, stealth (though introduced as a mechanic) is not functional. Trigins will kill you in a single hit, and the game's version of a difficulty curve is simply to throw more and more enemies at you at a time. It never gets more challenging from a skill perspective; it just throws more of the same challenge at you until the end of the game. The armor mechanic is okay at best, as it does give you more hit points and the sprint meter and crouching / going prone works fairly well to stabilize weapons and focus aim. However the game also suffers from bad vehicles. The vehicles are nearly un-drivable due to their half first person camera viewing. The third person viewpoint actually makes the car more un-drivable. In any case the vehicles require you to drive and shoot at the same time, and this just make sit incredibly hard not to crash into everything and incredibly hard to kill anything in a vehicle while moving. Far Cry also will spawn in helicopters ontop of your character providing instant death. The game is also prone to glitches such as bullets not activating collision detection, enemies shooting through walls, enemies freezing, audio and visual glitches, as well as many others.  Finally the game does attempt two boss fights. One of these is very easy and hardly of note and the second one broken. When fighting Crow on the freight ship, the game has you fight a heavily buffed helicopter with a rocket launcher. The helicopter can take 15 rockets and Crow has a mini-gun that can shred your armor and health instantly. You can see how this is broken as heck...Presentation however is where Far Cry earns some credit. The level designs tend to be functional and original in the late game. They show a level of creativity that takes you from tree top testing facilities to a massive volcano. Each of these levels provides ample cover and weapons (disregarding the enemy game play of course). Also the graphics actually look fairly decent. As a game from 2004, on high setting the water looks phenomenal and the game itself is pretty average. The FMV cut scenes, while pretty rough, are also fairly good for FMV of the time. In short the presentation of Far Cry was its saving grace and actually gave me something to look forward to in each level. So now to summarize...Pros:- Average FMV cut scenes- Strong level variety and design- Strong enemy variety- Average graphics for 2004- Satisfying boat level because only the boats aren't brokenCons:- Forgettable and repetitive OST- Poor use of SFX- Prone to major glitches- Most of the guns are unusable- Poorly implemented mechanics- Bipolar AI.- Constant instant kills from enemies.- Broken boss fights and helicopter spawning- Dam. - Nonsensical story- Generally bad one liners and forgettable charactersFor you completionists in the crowd this game is not for you. While easy to complete in the sense that it has no "new game plus" or bonuses beyond beating it on normal, it's still a pain due to how broken it is. Be prepared to get angry. Some levels are broken due to the enemies being hyper intelligent. Dam is an excellent example of this because the player character has no basic melee attack and the game only gives you a machine gun with ten bullets. You will die over and over again at this point hopelessly running through hundreds of tirgins attempting to reach a checkpoint. There are other moments like this that are breathtakingly bad but I don't have all the space to recount them. For completing the game you will unlock mods and statistics mode. Mods are useable as there was a modding community for the game, however I haven't a clue if there is one that fixes the issues with the 1.4 patch. Statistics mode is the exact same game with a few additions like a kill counter and an accuracy rating at the end of the level. While it's nice that Ubisoft added a completion bonus to the game, this bonus really offers no new content and really isn't worth the trouble. If you hated this game once, you’re not going to love it because of statistics. So to conclude i'd give this game a 4.2 out of 10 (as it did have its moments and honestly wasn't the worst thing I’ve ever touched) and a completionist rating of Plook at it!

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												Replayed this game. I'll start off again with the great stunning visuals within this game (of it's time.) Best part of all, you don't need anything too high-end to play this title. The story is rather short and but clear enough to understand the premis of the game. Cutscenes happen almost instantly and you resume playing in an instant as well. Almost makes you wonder what had just happend after the short duration. Gameplay is rather repetitive. You kill, and kill some more. Unlike the other Far Cry games in the franchise, you can't really attempt stealth in this game. Enemies will spot you from afar. Leaving you in a gunfight against a great number of enemies. The game is also rather hard. Mainly because shooting one enemy will alert the rest. Again, no stealth feature was implemented. Despite all the setbacks, it is still a good game back in it's day (still is.) If you're a fan of games that consists of guns blazing. This would be a game to add to your library. I recommend!

content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												I thought Far Cry 2 was the hardest in the series HA HA I was so wrong. AI is very smart here and the fact that you can't save whenever you want makes it even more difficult. This game's hardest setting have some hilariously hard parts where you'll  want to punch your screen after the 40th try (the part when the girl drives and you shoot, GOD DAMN THAT PART). Although the voice acting, the cutscenes and the story are terrible, the gameplay and graphics (for its time) are superb. It is very satisfactory when you make a headshot with your good old M4 from a long distance. A good variety of weapons. The multiplayer is still there, but you have to be lucky to find someone playing. The rooms are usually filled up with BOTS. It can be pretty fun though when a miracle happens and a room fills up. If you want a challenging FPS, this is for you.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												The start of the epic farcry series, farcry has made a well start. The graphics where pretty good for its age, the enimies had a good level of difficulty with them compared to other games where the enimies where pathetic. The caracters sadly wern't really memorable except for my opinion jack who was pretty funny sometimes. There is a small variety of wepons but you can have fun with them all [my favorite one is the shotgun] as well as some sweet gadgets like the thermal goggles.  The bosses where a bit of a shame as they where simply easy to kill [excluding crowe in the helicopter]. Speaking of which the story was similar to half-life, BIG BAD SCIENCE EXPIRIMENTS GONE WRONG however with a twist as you yourself have to escape it and to me it was a pretty decent plot. So to total it up I do recomend this game for those who want to see the origins of the farcry series.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												Fun game! Far Cry is really inventive and seems ahead of its time in many respects. Once you get over the slightly dated graphics, you'll notice all the enjoyable things that make the hours fly by. The gameplay is excellent, and the level design is very good. Each time I felt the game might begin to feel repetitive, some new elements were introduced, and had me hooked right back in. There are cars, boats, choppers, turrets, tunnels, ruins, fortresses, mercenaries, monsters... Lots of things to get excited about, lots of variation. I'm a pretty decent FPS guy, and I always go for the "normal" setting, to treat all games equally... but I was surprised at how challenging this game is. I'm not used to dying this much. Most of the time, it's OK, though, because it forces the player to take a more stealthy and planned approach to combat than in most shooters. But sometimes the high level of difficulty has to be blamed on ridiculously difficult bosses (and areas), and that got a little tedious at times. I bet that 80% of the total game time was spent on a handful of tough situations that had to be repeated over and over and over again. Of course, as many have pointed out, the protagonist in Far Cry is voiced by perhaps the worst voice actor I've ever heard, and that's saying a lot (I've been a gamer since the eighties). That factor certainly contributed to keep me out of the story, so I could  never really relate to what was going on in the story. Thankfully, it didn't take too long to get used to that fact and just go along with it, have fun, shoot stuff, get blown up, laugh and go at it again. 7/10[24.7 hrs total game time]

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												I enjoyed  Far Cry , it's a good ol' classic romp,  across a mad evil-scientist's desert island lair; the classic videogame tropes don't end there  In terms of graphics issues mentioned by other posters. I managed to run the game on the highest settings, although I did get a black screen the first time around. I dropped the water quality down one notch from ultra-high and after that it seemed to start-up fine. So it's worth playing with.I did have a few issues with NPC's firing through walls, but not that often, maybe two or three times along a full play-through. Once I had to just jump into a 4wd and speed off to the next encounter as there was no way to kill them.Although it probably is a little more difficult than more recent FPS's, Medium didn't feel like too bad a difficulty to play with. But I had to use all the tools at my disposal. Using the binoculars to surveil the next target location, ahead of engaging visible enemy troops helped to work out true numbers (even through soft cover); as well as making them appear on the mini-map. Also the NVG'ish Goggles (Cry Vision on the Keyboard Mapping) helped to assess and take out targets' before they saw me.All in all, it was well worth a play through and I'd definitely recommend picking up a copy, especially if it's on sale. Enjoy.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												Far Cry is a first entry to the far cry series in which the name of the game is actually connected to the plot.Although it's an old game – it is still works on modern system (although there can be some problems but there are solutions on the internet) and it still looks beautiful.The game unlike it "sequels" is not a sandbox but a collection of maps, in whice each map is an open environment to travel from point A to B in any approach you choose (at least on the easiest difficulty)Let me tell you this, this is a hard game even on the easiest difficulty and Realistic difficulty? don’t even try unless you want some challenge and then getting frustrated because the enemy AI is cheating on every difficulty with their pinpoint accuracy and their x-ray vision that allow them to see through walls that are made of fabric like tents and of course can shot you through them (although you can also do this but sadly you don’t have x-ray vision).It's not a bad game but not really good either, it's an important game as part of the evolution of the open environment and sandbox genre and I can only recommend it to those who are curious about the origin of the Far cry franchise.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												I never payed attention to this game when it first came out, I wasn't and am still not the biggest fan of first person shooters.  On a revisit though, this game isn't half bad.  You have to be exceptionally stealthy and tactics matter.  Go in guns blazing guaratees your death.  Even at ten years old the AI of the enemy is good enough to really hurt your ability to advance.  The setting is even interesting from a historical stanpoint.  The game is very long with some interesting level design for most of the game, and to give it some more legs you are given a serviceable story with incredibly bad acting, think 80s action movies.  With that they introduce some scifi elements that really detract from the good enemy AI, think mutants, but it didn't stop me from playing to the end.I recommend it on the basis that you go in aware it was a top of the line game from another time and definitly shows it's age.

												Over a decade later, how does this first title in a franchise hold up?Well, it's frustratingly difficult even on the easiest settings. It has a stupid "checkpoint" system which means you have to redo the same sections over and over. There's the odd bug and glitch. And the voice acting is atrocious.Nonetheless, it's still very enjoyable to play. The combat is fast and satisfying. The environments, though looking very dated, are great to explore. And it manages to annoy you enough that you want to keep going, because you know you'll have a particular spot licked if you try just one more time.I wanted to hate this, but I can't. I simply had too much fun with it. And you will, too.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												A game that is still good, even though it's 11 years old.Expect to spend > 20 hours on your first playthrough. This game is very difficult, and you have to evolve a different strategy for each firefight. It's a nice mix between open-world and linear, where you can take multiple paths to reach the same goal depending on your playstyle. The story is OK, but I'd recommend getting a quicksave mod; otherwise you'll spend half your time just walking back to the action from the last save point. The AI is a bit derpy, but the game is still challenging.Also, it runs amazingly well. 1080p 900fps on a 750 Ti, and with graphics to rival any much newer game!If you're considering getting this game, do. It's regularly reduced to less than £2 in sales.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
												Crytek is a developer that knows how to create near perfect first person shooters. Far Cry is another of those examples from their repertoire. This is some great, solid stuff, despite the bugs and glitches. A game to remember. Far Cry is hard. A true challenge even at the easier difficulty settings. Performance is an issue even for today's hardware standards. The game seems to need a fresh system restart to run at its full potential. There are plenty of bugs and glitches. Some were so major that I was forced to reload a save point several times. The game engine and physics is different than most other games, and this takes a little getting used to. The main character's voice acting is pretty bad. Almost to the point of making it sound like a comedy. For whatever idiotic reason, the game alters the Windows audio settings to its liking without setting them back to their original state. This is extremely annoying. Staying in the subject of sound, do a Google search and you will see the massive amount of sound problems people experience in this game. To access the multiplayer portion of the game, one is forced to register and create an account with Ubisoft, which is absolutely ridiculous. The developers clearly reward players who specialize in stealth and skill shots rather than running and gunning. The atmosphere, mood, and setting are superb; providing a tense and exciting experience almost every second of the game. The tension you will experience is not often produced by other games at this same level. There are many parts where you will be spooked and surprised by what comes around the corner or appears suddenly. It is all done very well. Level design in this game is outstanding. The AI is good, and there is always a challenge. Far Cry is all thriller, no filler.Far Cry is great.

content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
												I want to make a huge list of reasons why you shouldn't give them your money for this game. It all boils down to the game being unplayable and tedious. Combat boils down to you camping a doorway and shooting enemies as they enter your reticle one by one. If you play this like any regular fps you will get killed instantly, more often than not you won't even know where the bots were that shot you to death. The finale of the third level has you scale a ladder that you'll get stuck on, unable to pull out your gun while a helicopter rains down bullets on you without you being able to run away to dodge or retaliate. If your idea of a fun fps is watching helplessly as your hp bar go from over 100% to zero in less than a second from an unfair number of overly strong bots (on normal ffs) then this is the game for you. Skip Far Cry 1 and 2, the first good one is 3.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2015
												I'll review what little bit I managed to play. The intro cutscene seemed to make no sense and it was just a whole lot of random♥♥♥♥♥♥and then you are taken into a tutorial, and this is where you find out that the controls suck balls.I won't get too in depth with it but crouching is weird and sometimes it doesn't even do the animation and your screen just jerks down. Sprinting is about 2% faster than your normal speed so all it really does is make you less accurate, does a weird animation and uses up your energy which you need to jump and I think you need it to hold your breath for some reason.After a little bit of walking you are introduced to the stealth system... Which doesn't work. Press G to throw a rock which is for some strange reason the same button used to throw grenades but that's just a little weird. Now here is why it's broken. There is no delay between an enemy thinking they hear you and them shooting you and this is the best part of the 'stealth' system, I was trying to sneak around and I threw a rock to get some enemies to move and what do they do? Shout 'I've found him!' and they did a 180 and shoot me. So it thinks that it has stealth mechanics but doesn't so your best bet is just shooting everyone but, surprise! sometimes you just die. I don't know how, I thought I had everyone killed but I was being shot so I went and hid and then BAM, dead and remember how sprinting only makes you go 2% faster? yeah have fun running back, oh I'm sorry, taking a leisurely stroll back to where you were to try and kill everyone again. Animations are just plain lazy, don't look at the machete because you may end up throwing up. Now, to end this review I will leave you with this. What happens when you decide that it's a terrible game that hardly works? You try to leave, what happens if you try to leave? It crashes and your cursor disappears of screen making it basically impossible to close though I did manage to get my cursor to reappear after locking my account and unlocking it again so there's that.pros- I can't wait to uninstall it so that's a pluscons-stealth system is broken-ai is broken-sometimes you just die because the game decided you should die-movement system is broken-game is broken so don't buy it-1/10

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												This one is thought to enjoy. Far Cry has without a doubt some nice moments and some nice open levels. Many elements of it have been recycled in Crysis as well as later Far Cry games and it's nice to see how it all started. But Far Cry does have a few to many fatal flaws to recommend.Most prominent would be the insane difficult, most enemies can kill you with two or three hits. By itself that wouldn't be a problem, as stealth would be the logical answer, but stealth doesn't work here. Enemies can spot you from miles away and will instantly shot at you when you use your sniper rifle. There is a silence gun in the game as well, but that doesn't work long range. Enemies are also far too fast on their legs, so you can't really play hide and seek, the enemies will have you surrounded you long before you can find cover.To make this issue even worse, the game frequently moves away from the open island levels and into buildings and bunkers. In those settings you are often confronted with enemies right in front of you after you open a door, leaving no room to do anything from a distance. Your binoculars, that help to detect and mark enemies on open terrain, become useless here.The next problem is the lack of quicksave, despite being at times pretty open, Far Cry sticks to a checkpoint system and linear progression, but when exactly you will hit a checkpoint is unpredictable due to the openness of the levels. They are scattered more or less randomly throughout the levels. Luckily the the lack of quicksave can be fixed, as quicksave function can be enabled by editing a config file, it's just not exposed in the GUI.The game has it's moments where things click, but those moments don't last very long. One moment you might be impressed by the level of foliage the game presents you with, but the next moment you might already be shot dead from an enemy that you didn't see coming.After now quite some hours into the game my frustration with the game, despite having quicksave, is getting a lot bigger than the enjoyment I am getting out of it. There are just too many situations where the game doesn't communicate what you have to do and you have to trial&error yourself through far too many enemies. The game never manages to establish a proper flow.On top of all that I also had plenty of problems getting the game to run in Windows10. Lowering lighting settings to "High" and installing the AMD64 patch made the game start properly, but even after that it's still hanging when you exist it.Edit: I finished the game now and some of the later levels, especially when you run around with a companion NPC, tend to be more fun and interesting than fighting in caves against monsters. However the basic combat still stays quite frustrating as there just isn't a good way to attack enemies in a stealthy way. It always ends up chaotically with a lot of trial&error and a lot of dying.The weapon balance and control also seems out of whack. The RPG is drastically underpowered and slow moving, requiring four or more rounds to kill one of the bigger enemies, assuming you can hit them in the first place. Moving with a weapon while watching through the scope will disengage the scope, but only after a short delay and it won't reengage the scope when you still hold the button. Some weapons also require a hold for the scope while other do it as toggle. Getting a good zoom level on the scope also requires some additional button presses. All this makes scope use rather cumbersome.The story also isn't anything special. Good guy vs evil doctor and his monsters, with a few minor twists and turns thrown in.So overall this just isn't that good of a game. Has it's moments, but also far too much frustration and annoyance.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												2004 was an exciting year for gaming, and this was one of that year's flagship titles.  I skipped over it until 2014, when I picked up all the Far Cry games in a set.  I decided to play them in order.This game did not age well.  It runs very poorly on modern hardware.  Every aspect of its design is an example of a mistake we've learned from.  It felt like such a chore, that I gave up about 60% of the way through and skimmed through an LP instead of finishing it myself.  I've never done that for any game before.I can't recommend this, unless you're playing it for nostalgia or a bit of education in gaming history.

												However groundbreaking this game may have been when it came out, its successors have only served to highlight some deep flaws. The stealth - a core element of the gameplay - is often a joke thanks to inconsistent line of sight and terrain mechanics, while the combat is awkward and overly difficult due to stiff controls and animations. 												While the game itself stands up to the test of time, the compatability issues are very frustrating on many modern computers.First off, the steam version of this game has an old bug present which allows AI to see and shoot through certain walls. This can be fixed by modding the game or downloading a fix patch. number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Is it past 2005? Yes? Don't buy this game.Although it was considered ground breaking and innovative in it's time, it has not aged well and is now mediocre at best plus a BUNCH of bugs and a ridiculous amount of difficulty. I just finished the campaign and I will not be playing the game at all after that. I simply wanted to play through it so I could say I played the whole series. One of my main gripes with this game is the way the AI can perfectly shoot you through walls. I'm all for bullets going through tents (it seems the buildings in the compounds are made of the same material as tents or whatever) and all but it should be a random chest-height spray that you can easily avoid. Not perfect pinpoint aim right at you no matter where you move or how you attempt to dodge. Couple that with the fact that you can easily die in 3-4 bullets, and you get some really, really frustrating gameplay. I know this was made in 2004 and I gave it the benefit of the doubt in that regard. But, even in 2004, I expect to be safe from outside gunfire when I enter a building. Also, another thing that frustrated me were the stairs. They are extremely broken, mostly the metal ones, and I often got stuck and had to spam prone/jump to get out of the glitched area. This could often be a problem when in a fight as you can't really walk up these stairs without glitch-hopping and jumpinh around.Lastly, the games story was really bland. For almost the whole thing, but especially at the end I was questioning why I was doing what I was doing.SPOILERS AHEADI want to take this time to rant about the end of the game and how stupid/confusing it was. So for those of you who have played it, when you blow up the nuke, all of a sudden you are now captured in a helicopter with the main bad guy? It made no sense to me. I thought the game was going to end with that nuke but nope instead you get put into a typical fight for survival where you are striped of all weapons and equipment hooray! And then the end where you got to kill Doyle? Was his betrayal not the most obvious thing or what. I thought literally from the moment he first contacted me that he was going to end up being a bad guy in the end. Really predictable and boring story coupled with bad voice acting to boot, I'm just glad it's over.
