number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 16, 2014
												Apparently I played this game about 124 hours to date and I think that's a wrong number. I figure I played the game 5 times that and maybe 10 times that. It's a great game. The eye candy is about as pleasant as can be for a PC that has limits on graphics power. It's a great game for single player action with the headphones on, on a rainy day outside and you're in the tropics, everything blue and sunny and your listening to jungle birds making nice sounds, waves lapping the beach and your looking for baddies. It's a classic. The enemy are not the smartest but they where never intended to be the smartest. This is a practice game, a learner, a reliable experience from beginning to end and you're going to love the scenery because it's nice to look at. The monsters are horrible and deserve no mercy and so it's easy fraging them and the enemy is a mix of fools, idiots and really bad nasty people. The vehicles are very good and the sound is very good. Make sure you can play it on the highest settings because this game looks very nice at the highest settings and that's when all the birds, little fish and insects com out. It's a classic and in the best of the best first person shooters of all time. There so many maps available for the game and there are map packs that are better than the game's original maps that are already excellent. You could buy this game, play out it's maps, install map packs and play it for years and never see the same map twice. A very good game with very good community support and it's very very stable with a PC built about 3-4 years after the game's release date. Around the game's release date the PCs had some issues with the game but that all changed when the PCs improved and software updates where released. The game is now solid. Buy it. You'll love it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												10 years later, this is still one of the best first person shooters I've ever played. Not a ton of weapons but good choices and great mechanics. The open world approach is awesome and the stealth system is perfect. The story is good despite the cheesily delivered voiceovers. I especially loved how the atmosphere is further realized when you pay attention to the banter between mercs. The checkpoint save system was a tad annoying especially since a few of the bossfights I thought were unnecessarily tough. This game is the perfect blend of oldschool and new, and everyone should play through it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Far cry is a game truly unlike any other. The AI is actually smart, you HAVE to have a different strategy for each mission, there is a wide variety of weapons, the absolutely beautiful enviroment (considering this is a game from 10 years ago), and it never gets old to see one of the mercenaries blow up. These are the main pros in this game. Some cons include the AI being a bit too smart (e.g. knowing where you are and shooting you while you are in a tent. It's like the walls aren't even there), and it is really not "open world". You can go wherever, but it would be EXTREMELY difficult to survive considering the helicopters that come at you. In conclusion, I seriously love this game and anyone who is a fan of a good FPS needs this in his/her library.

												I never got around to playing this when it was new: so this is a review based on how I view it today.  Overall a pretty good game, you can see how this game heavily influenced games today.  This game however pulls heavily from things people liked about Battlefield 1942 and Counter Strike in terms of gameplay, reload time, and hit detection.  A very good FPS single player game with monsters and soldiers.... that being said:  I found myself getting bored due to random difficulty between levels.  FLY through 2 levels and get stuck fighting a helecopter for a 30 mins.  The highlights - Good gun play, shooting, and the vehicles are fun.  The bad is very poor/Cheating AI and appears to be sandbox gameplay but its not.  I recomend as a discount fps but there is better out now. - oh yea... Cheesy story!

												Far Cry is an excellent game from 2004.  It is much improved with the FCAM mod. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
												I rate the game Far Cry 2.5/5. Not Good. Not even okay.This was probably one of the most graphically beautiful games of its time (Unreal Tournament 2004 is more beautiful by far however) and features fairly good AI and fairly large areas (but not as large as those in UT 2004). However it features a generic story filled with bad dialogue, worse voice acting and features cutscenes needlessly focusing on computer generated T&A throughout. To make matters worse this game is extremely hard, even on the easiest difficulty level and the checkpoint-based save system makes things even harder. (This game was so difficult I had to resort to using a left-over developer debug mode to make my character invincible so I could get through this game at all). This high difficulty results in high frustration and while many of the gameplay areas and levels are fairly big, this doesn't prevent them from being designed in an extremely linear manner. Many of the outdoor areas found in this game were re-used in the far more open-ended and excellently designed Far Cry 3 game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 10, 2011
												FPS with heavy emphasis on stealth. Really easy to die in, a full second of sustaining machine gun fire will destroy your armor and health. No regenerating health, uses a checkpoint system rather than letting you quicksave. Thus, it can be frustrating at times to get through a tough part, only to get killed by a single guy that you overlooked or had no way of being aware of his presence. The game is not that open-ended, as even though there are multiple islands when you're outside, there is usually nothing on the other ones in the area. In fact the game outright killed me once when I was just trying to get around to another part of the main island that it decided I shouldn't go to. That said, the game can be frustrating, but the anticipation of whether you'll be discovered is great and it's very satisfying to overcome the challenges it presents.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												Very, very good game. One of the few genuinely difficult games that I've played. (Note that I only have ~10 hours on record on Steam, but I've played far more on a disc install before I had steam!) On the high difficulties, the enemies are far too good for the player to take the CoD approach and just run in guns-blazing.If you're not an experienced FPSer, then no way will you be able to manage the top difficulty levels; even if you are, then you'll still find it very challenging and rewarding!As others have said, there aren't many checkpoints, which can be a bit annoying... but I think it's a good thing: you have to remain focused the whole time; just meeting a pair of enemies when you're not paying attention, then you can die (not usual, but completely possible), which I think is great.The game definitely starts off better than it ends: I prefer playing against people than mutant monkeys, personally.At the moment it's only £1.74 on Steam. A game of this quality, for that price ? I can't think of one reason why you shouldn't buy it!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												Great Game, looks fantastic for its age. Oddly enough, in most games the cutscenes look better than the actual game, here it is th eopposite, the cutscenes are a bit clunky and jarring, but still have their charm. The Missions are wide open so there are plenty of routes to take to get to the end, especially the missions with multiple islands. This is cool, especially when you can choose to be stealthy, snipe your opponents, or just run in guns a-blazing!The game is pretty challenging even on the lower difficulties. You will have to replay certains parts over and over again, until you finally learn all the enemy patterns and placement, and can do the section near-flawlessly. Checkpoint system is really good with multiple checkpoints per level, however certain checkpoints are a bit too far apart. Driving is a bit clunky, but there is something about first-erson driving in these types of games, that I just love. Finally the last few levels will most likely make you pull your hair out in frustration, I think they could have provided a bit more health and armor packs.All in all great, classic FPS Adventure!

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Only recommended if you enjoy a bit of a challenge otherwise not recommended.Definitely your grandfather's FPS.  By that I mean absolutely brutal difficulty where one guy can gun you down in under 2 seconds, health packs and armor pickups are the only way to regain health and an AI with an almost omniscient ability to spot you instantly in even the densest jungle foliage from 6 miles off or hear you crouch walking 2 rooms over.  Also, checkpoint only saving which can result in replaying certain parts over, and over, and over...Only play if you have an indomitable spirit and a fair amount of patience.  If you are a run and gun style player, you might wanna skip the first in this series or play on one of the easy difficulties.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Well, yes and no. It can be good, but lots of other FPS games are better.It has a lot of good things; the open environment works surprisingly well, the many boats, cars and so on are a lot of fun and sniping and using googles is great. But it also has a lot of problems: First of all, the autosave is horrible, often I had to replay a lot I already had cleared a dozen times before I could get to the one point I had a problem with. We should just be allowed to save ourselves. Second, the zoom is very very old fashioned with all weapons lacking special scopes, like ordinary M4 machine guns. It looks horrible "zooming" with them. Thirdly, and possible most important, it indulge you to play stealth, sneaking around and so on, and most of the outdoor game looks like this was the way it was meant to play. BUT it is more or less impossible. Even on the easier levels the enemies are often simply impossible to sneak close to or around. When I got tired of trying about 20 times, I just front out assaulted a heavy defend fortress, and won. This I have tried several times in the game. It is far easier just going on a rampage up front killing everything than trying just to sneak around one enemy. Fourth, it is simply to long and, especially because of the lousy autosave, it really feels long. Fifth, it got lots of bugs. If you succed to sneak kill the enemies before they awaken their friends, there might happen a bug where the normal damage system no longer functions. For example, one place in the game, I sprayed a chopper with 8 missiles, nothing happened. Then I tried from the save point again, sprayed with 20 machine gun bullets just for the heck of it, and it blew up... Lots of other bugs also exist. And lastly, neither the plot, especially the anti-climatic ending, nor the gameplay is exciting enough to justify the long gameplay. It just become too much the same, to tedious. All in all, this game can be worth playing, but so are hundred of other games that I would advise you to prefer over this.

Posted: October 29, 2015
												This game will always hold a special place in my heart as the game that introduced me to first person shooters. This and Call of Duty 1 were those games. When I was about 7-8 years old I didn't understand at first at how insanely difficult this game is and how much skill it takes to beat it at least at medium difficulty. I was just replaying random levels that my dad already completed. Then in 2015 I finally got to play it again after all these years and it felt amazing. This game will ♥♥♥♥ you up. It is extemely difficult when you get to the second half of the game and those annoying ♥♥♥♥ing mutants come out. Nevertheless , the gameplay is what makes this game great. It has great variety of guns , vehicles and it has an open way to complete your objectives. But like I said , everything gets thrown out of the window when the second half of the game comes. Think of it as the dark souls of fps games. Anyway I highly recommend you try this out as this is a must play true classic and you will notice how different this is from your typical cod and battlefield.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Though not the deepest of experiences, and still quite a tall order on even a modern non-gaming PC, Far Cry is still pretty fun. But be warned-- behind the reassuring veneer of campy-as-hell voice acting and action setpiece-packed first hour or so, this game is pretty hard, yo. The checkpoints are sparsely laid, and getting past every enemy camp is a twenty-minute ordeal of tagging all the enemies with the binoculars, taking out the snipers, waiting for someone to wander off alone, shooting them, moving to a new hiding spot, waiting for the heat to die down, and repeating. This is all because attempting anything other than the methodical stealthy approach will get you swiftly killed, because the player character's bullet resistance is vaguely realistic, and the enemies can see you from literally a mile away.Essentially, this is the poor man's version of Crysis, in which you have to take on a vast army in the jungle alone and without a superpowered nanosuit because you don't own a NASA supercomputer.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												10 years later, this is still one of the best first person shooters I've ever played. Not a ton of weapons but good choices and great mechanics. The open world approach is awesome and the stealth system is perfect. The story is good despite the cheesily delivered voiceovers. I especially loved how the atmosphere is further realized when you pay attention to the banter between mercs. The checkpoint save system was a tad annoying especially since a few of the bossfights I thought were unnecessarily tough. This game is the perfect blend of oldschool and new, and everyone should play through it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Awful cheesy writing. Good Controls...impossible scenarios. Kind of like the action movies we all loved from the 80s, in video game form. But impossibly long...everytime I thought it was going to be over or near the end it just keeps going. In some ways i'd like to consider that high value, but I guess for me I prefer my FPS games a bit shorter. One other complaint that I am sure is included in most other reviews, is there is a terrible glitch that causes the enemy to easily target and shoot you through walls in some areas, as if the wall isn't even there. This can get very annoying at times. But thankfully it only occurs in certain places, and you can adapt your strategy to work around this problem.I suspect when it came out this game introduced a lot of new concepts to the FPS genre, and even by todays standards it isn't a terrible game. However I don't know that playing it is really necessary unless you're hardcore and want to play every FPS or every Far Cry game in the series. Final Verdict: Not amazing by today's standards (obviously as it has been around for at least a decade). I wouldn't recommend for the casual FPS player like myself. However for those looking for older style FPS game play with higher difficulty which requires a bit of strategy and guerrilla tactics, and a lack of gimmicks that make the game easier (like slow-mo in F.E.A.R.) this game is still pretty solid.2004 Rating: 9/10 (1 point off for the cheesy scenes with Val)2014 Rating: 7/10

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												I loved FC2, had a love/hate relationship with FC3, which got a little better in FC4, so I thought I should go back to the origins of the series.  BIG mistake.  This is nigh on unplayable.  It is a "die and retry" game to the max (see Edge of Tomorrow).  Enemies kill you before you know they are there, and can shoot through obstacles that prevent you from even seeing them.  Coupled with a poor checkpoint save system, you will find yourself dying repeatedly and redoing everything over and over and over and over and over and over until you figure out that magic sequence of actions that will get you through to the end. And that's on "Easy".  On top of all that, despite the 2004-level graphics, it is a resource-hungry pig.  I could not even run  it on the highest settings (which I could for FC2 and FC3), and even on lower levels it would lag awkwardly just when you did not need it.  Cap it off with no gamepad support, and it is a loser all around.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Far Cry (1) was my first experience with the Far Cry franchise and I'm glad I started with it instead of 2, 3, or even 4. Although the graphics are dated (it's 11 years old at this point) and other mechanics of the game were lacking or missing that can be found in modern shooters, I seriously loved this game. I have a weakness for old-school-style shooters and even though this was a 2004 title, it felt older in a way, in a good way. It's hard to explain but little things like the 90's-sounding music (I think the 90's never really went away until 2006 or so), the Duke Nukem-esque punchlines, the horrible voice acting, and the crude view models just made the game feel right. All of these things might be bad to people but I think it was a fun experience. The weapon variety was low but the enemies had a lot more variety as the game went on. I was surprised at how advanced and smooth the physics were for a game as old as this. Corpses were never stationary. You could always shoot them and see them slide, run through a banner and watch it swing realistically, and push things around at will. Very cool feature in a game that redefined the genre for it's time. The game is damn hard sometimes too. I played on the 3rd hardest difficulty and still found myself♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at the game ready to quit. It's a serious challenge at times. Low on ammo, no armor left, low health, and still plenty of grenade-tossing enemies out there makes for a really interesting time. It's rewarding though to play through a checkpoint 30 times and FINALLY make it to the next one in one piece. There is no spoon-feeding on this game when it comes to difficulty. Enemy AI is relentlessly fast, attentive, and accurate. It works though because if this game had dumb or slow AI, the game would be too easy and not have that me-against-a-small-army-feel. You always feel outnumbered but not usually outgunned (Except for Krieger and Crow). You could be across the beach half a kilometer away laying down in bushes and a guy will notice you and raise the alarm. Damn. Better go back and try again from the checkpoint. Which leads me to my next point. The checkpoints on this game are HORRID. If there was one thing that made me think "What in the hell were the develoeprs thinking?" it was the checkpoints. AWFUL. They were so far between that dying once could mean redoing over an hour's worth of tedious sneaking and fragging. The worst was the final boss (Krieger) in which you could kill him, run around to the next elevator, pause (thinking that by now the game HAS TO have saved and put you at a new checkpoint), click back to the last checkpoint, and the game STILL didn't save your boss progress or create a new checkpoint: It would then spawn me back to the beginning of the boss fight (that I BARELY made it through on accident after 57 attempts. I guess 58 attempts never hurt?). Other than the checkpoints this game really kicked♥♥♥♥♥ It had a good barebones feel, hilarious jokes, witty cutscenes, no nonsense but challenging gameplay, a cliche storyline (that at the time I think was probably inventive or still interesting), and a likeable protagonist. I really couldn't ask for much more. 9/10 for Far Cry.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												Even games with the best of intentions come and go, if they fall short in a couple key areas, to be eventually shuffled off to the graveyard of industry footnotes. A new graphical innovation here, a good sense of humor there, but something just doesn't gel. With Far Cry, however, you can see so many places where things could have gone wrong, but didn't. The AI could easily have been blindly aggressive or stone deaf. The load times could have been constant and distracting. In almost all major areas, Far Cry manages to walk the tightrope of game design over a chasm of Things Gone Wrong. I've always wondered why no one apparently tried to license the AI of the Marines in Half-Life, because after that, I was always a little bit disappointed with the FPSs that came after. And finally someone has answered the call and the creatures here are actually smart.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2013
												This game has terrible voice acting, a sub-par storyline, and infuriating gameplay at times, and yet I find myself wanting to triumph over it all the more. This is an excellent game if you like a challenge or are a masochist. If you think you find yourself replaying the same segment repeatedly early on, just wait until about halfway through the game when the enemies that are capable of jumping across the map and slashing at your face to kill you in two hits even though you have a full set of armor and are completely healthy are given rocket launchers. Were you having fun progressing the story line? Too bad, you're going to be there for at least three hours popping blood vessels in your head from all of your irritatingly failed attempts at making it to the next checkpoint just so you don't have to complete the segment a seventy sixth time. I never considered myself a decent gamer, by any means, but I have never had this much trouble getting through a game on the normal difficulty. It is the most unforgiving gameplay I have ever subject myself to and yet each small accomplishment makes you strive for more. It is difficult, but not impossible. It feels very rewarding to complete and I would recommend it to anyone looking for something difficult. I wouldn't necessarily if it weren't so cheap, but as it stands, I'd say it's worth it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												I only played this game out of some sort of self imposed obligation to at least see where the franchise came from. Having played instincts before this, I can say that this game is better in almost every regard, combat, stealth, pacing and otherwise, but I am still dissapointed that you never get the predator mode which instincts offered. Be that as it may it was still a competent game. But that isn't enough to get a passing grade.This games story is dumb. I mean it is B-movie dumb and the intro you get to explain your involvment is a wordless acid trip that leaves you more confused then informed, it is literally a wordless sequence of unrelated three second clips. The voice acting and dialog of the main character is laughable and it is made more apparent by the fact that everyone else sounds and talks reasonably, it has a distinct feel of satire to it that I'm not sure is intended but is actually kind of charming and funny, but not enough to save it.The gameplay is fairly tight, with an armor and health system, well placed checkpoints, solid stealth system for such a dated game, and a good variety of enemies and weapons. It's not the prettiest game, but hey that won't be why you play it.Story: 4/10Gameplay: 7/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												FarCry is a beautifully presented, charming, organic FPS that will serve as a great use of one's time and money, though that time will be marred by some minor errors.FarCry's mechanics are based around limited weapon slots, health management and stealth (though some missions will evolve into full on shootouts after a nice build up) with a plethora of enemies, enemy types and level designs ranging from expansive tropical locations to claustrophobic labs straight out of cheesy Sci-Fi dreams infested with Doom 3 looking monsters called Trigens. The game is incredibly long for newcomers but it's organic enough to allow people who are used to it to rush through levels should they know the best ways to get around the levels (hence my 6 hour playthrough as of writing this review, haven finished it a few hours ago). It also does well in terms of loading, with a loading screen only occuring at the start of each mission, and if you load a save and modern PCs shouldn't have issues with long load times like many did back in 2004.However a lot of FarCry requires attrition and getting used to. The Steam version has some levels fail and cause the occasional enemy to see you through walls, though it's still much preferrable to the new Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 port in terms of the stealth. The Trigens and the Mercanaries do insane amounts of damage with their weapons, and you'll have to make careful use of your binoculars to catch the occasional Sniper or Rocket Sniper. The vehicle sections are crap and are best used very quickly and abandoned to hide once you reach your destination.On the whole, however, it's an above average game marred by the occasional slip up in AI and balancing, but held up by the scope and the charm of the cheesy story and aesthetic, as well as the catharsis of the gameplay. FarCry is my favourite game, and I'm happy to say that the Steam version is about as good as the disc version from 2004, and better than 2014's console versions.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												I loved FC2, had a love/hate relationship with FC3, which got a little better in FC4, so I thought I should go back to the origins of the series.  BIG mistake.  This is nigh on unplayable.  It is a "die and retry" game to the max (see Edge of Tomorrow).  Enemies kill you before you know they are there, and can shoot through obstacles that prevent you from even seeing them.  Coupled with a poor checkpoint save system, you will find yourself dying repeatedly and redoing everything over and over and over and over and over and over until you figure out that magic sequence of actions that will get you through to the end. And that's on "Easy".  On top of all that, despite the 2004-level graphics, it is a resource-hungry pig.  I could not even run  it on the highest settings (which I could for FC2 and FC3), and even on lower levels it would lag awkwardly just when you did not need it.  Cap it off with no gamepad support, and it is a loser all around.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												10 years later, this is still one of the best first person shooters I've ever played. Not a ton of weapons but good choices and great mechanics. The open world approach is awesome and the stealth system is perfect. The story is good despite the cheesily delivered voiceovers. I especially loved how the atmosphere is further realized when you pay attention to the banter between mercs. The checkpoint save system was a tad annoying especially since a few of the bossfights I thought were unnecessarily tough. This game is the perfect blend of oldschool and new, and everyone should play through it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Far cry is a game truly unlike any other. The AI is actually smart, you HAVE to have a different strategy for each mission, there is a wide variety of weapons, the absolutely beautiful enviroment (considering this is a game from 10 years ago), and it never gets old to see one of the mercenaries blow up. These are the main pros in this game. Some cons include the AI being a bit too smart (e.g. knowing where you are and shooting you while you are in a tent. It's like the walls aren't even there), and it is really not "open world". You can go wherever, but it would be EXTREMELY difficult to survive considering the helicopters that come at you. In conclusion, I seriously love this game and anyone who is a fan of a good FPS needs this in his/her library.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Decent FPS for its time, but it has some flaws.  It has some bugs do a google search to find patches and fixes.  It has some game design issues as well.  1)  Enemies that can kill you very quickly (2 - 3 hits) and that are hard to kill.  This happens even at the lower difficulty  2) Stealth only works in certain circumstances  3)  Some enemies seem to have the force and feel your presence from across a valley and can then shoot you.  Worth buying if it is on sale for $5 or less.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Awful cheesy writing. Good Controls...impossible scenarios. Kind of like the action movies we all loved from the 80s, in video game form. But impossibly long...everytime I thought it was going to be over or near the end it just keeps going. In some ways i'd like to consider that high value, but I guess for me I prefer my FPS games a bit shorter. One other complaint that I am sure is included in most other reviews, is there is a terrible glitch that causes the enemy to easily target and shoot you through walls in some areas, as if the wall isn't even there. This can get very annoying at times. But thankfully it only occurs in certain places, and you can adapt your strategy to work around this problem.I suspect when it came out this game introduced a lot of new concepts to the FPS genre, and even by todays standards it isn't a terrible game. However I don't know that playing it is really necessary unless you're hardcore and want to play every FPS or every Far Cry game in the series. Final Verdict: Not amazing by today's standards (obviously as it has been around for at least a decade). I wouldn't recommend for the casual FPS player like myself. However for those looking for older style FPS game play with higher difficulty which requires a bit of strategy and guerrilla tactics, and a lack of gimmicks that make the game easier (like slow-mo in F.E.A.R.) this game is still pretty solid.2004 Rating: 9/10 (1 point off for the cheesy scenes with Val)2014 Rating: 7/10

content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
												One of the most unforgiving FPS I have ever played. Expect to die in this game...a lot. This isn't CoD where you can just run & gun without any consequences. You pull that crap in this game and after you die about a dozen times you'll come to realize that you have to approach enemies much differently in Far Cry. The maps are absolutely HUGE, and there are so many different ways to approach situations that you'll never get bored of playing the game over and over again. All of the things that make Far Cry 3 so popular are in this game as well, because it is the very first in the series after all. XD

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
												OverallThe tropical environments are beauitful and varied. Each section has different flora and flauna and soil and lighting (due to the different time of day). The maps are open and leave you free to use the various means at your disposal to get to your goal. The plot is amusingly B-grade Hollywood without the slightest hint of pretentiousness but still manages to surprise. The maps alternate between corridor and jungle levels and there is plenty of variety within that structure. Vehicle missions, hang-gliding, guarding a VIP, et al. The main voice actor does a funny and sometimes hilariously implausible cross between Napoleon Dynamite and Bruce Willias in Die Hard. Also the music in some of the jungle stages is outstanding. Borrowed from Hollywood with eerie Japanese-sounding woodwinds and gongs.I think it's an excellent shooter all around, but I especially admired it for the tense and scenic jungle stages. It's also famously difficult, about which I have some comments.GameplayThe first review I saw when I scanned the reviews a moment ago said this was the Dark Souls of FPSs, and I think that is a good way of putting it. It seems extremely difficult at first, but unless you have the see-through textures bug it's not cheap (although you can be the recipient of flukishly lucky headshots, just as you can be the giver). You have to play very slowly and deliberately, especially in the jungle levels, and you have to use all of the items in your arsenal, particularly the binoculars and the nightvision. Above all you have to learn to keep one eye glued to the detection meter. Not only does it tell you when you need to back off and dive into the bush, it also lets you know that there's someone out there in your field of vision if you look carefully for them. You also have to understand that the enemies have vision approximately as good as yours (that is, if you can see them they can see you). Sometimes they can see you when it's impossible to see them because of the draw distance, but that is more than offset by the fact that even when you're in their field of vision you get a grace period while the detection meter builds up. Also when you are in cover you can see them without them seeing you.Another point is this game has an usually high bonus for headshots versus bodyshots. It feels like about 5:1 to me. Especially against humans you should always be going for headshots, except when you're in a really bad spot where you don't have time to aim (bodyshots have a slight stunning effect against humans and armshots cause them to drop their weapons).The one matter related to difficulty that I think should have been fixed is it should be easier to track the source of gunfire on your HUD or in the world. The reason is occasionally there is an enemy, usually situated on higher ground, who can rapidly spot you when you come out of cover. If you're not playing with quicksaves you will often find yourself with low enough health that you will be killed in one shot, and sometimes you just can't find the guy with your binoculars while in the cover of foliage. So your only hope in those situations is to sprint for new cover and hope you can find the shooter from there.Difficulty Without quick saves as originally designed the game's medium difficulty should have been its hardest difficulty, and the harder difficulties should have been for NG+. Personally I did the first half without quicksaves but then applied the FCAM patch for the sake of graphics and used the quicksave option that goes with it. It takes all the frustration out of the game but also most of the suspense. Without your progress being at stake it doesn't really matter if you fail. And certain very busy stages of the game become outright easy when you can save incrementally every time you manage to take out a few guys without getting hit. I would recommend playing without quicksaves for as long as you can stand it. Maybe consult a FAQ as a palliative.

												This is a chronology of my experience with the game (if you don't want to read it, skip to the actual review):0.1 Hrs: What's going on in this opening cutscene?1 Hr: I'm really intruiged by this game. This is shaping up to be awesome!5Hrs: This game is cool! I love it! The music is awesome! I don't want this to be over!7 hrs: Man, this game is hard. It's still awesome though.8 hrs: I've memorized all the dialogue in this section... I've been on this damn section for 30 minutes.9 hrs: What's with the lip-syncing in this cutscene? It seems off.  I've watched it like 15 times by now.10 hrs: Ooh, a boss battle! This is awesome!11.5 (Still on same boss battle) Son of a.....You stupid a**holes, no, NO!12 hrs: (Still on boss battle) I think he's almost dead, no FUUUUUUUUUUUU...................13 hrs: Ok, we get a nice shot of Valerie bathing in a waterfall, the game's about to end... (nope)...I love this game, but I just want it to be over.14 hrs: We blew up the stuff, we're going to ride off into the sunset... WHAT THE HELL IS THIS BULL****??!!!15 hrs: Alright, I've killed the main villain, we're going to be happy, everything's cool (gets cockblocked) WHAT THE HELL?! Just be over already!!!!15.2 Hrs- 15.9 hrs: (gets cockblocked over and over) They should just call this cockblock simulator at this point... Jesus, have mercy on my soul. Please just end it.16.1 hrs: Ok, that should do it... is it over? Is it over? (gets cockblocked one more time) FUUUUUUUU16.2 hrs: OH MY LORD THANK THE HEAVENS! IT'S FINALLY OVER!Later: I should play this game again!Actual review: A kick-a** game with some kick-a** music, and a genuinly difficult experience for the masochistic gamer.A game I'm not ashamed to admit I beat on normal.... god only knows what realistic entails.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												This game will always hold a special place in my heart as the game that introduced me to first person shooters. This and Call of Duty 1 were those games. When I was about 7-8 years old I didn't understand at first at how insanely difficult this game is and how much skill it takes to beat it at least at medium difficulty. I was just replaying random levels that my dad already completed. Then in 2015 I finally got to play it again after all these years and it felt amazing. This game will ♥♥♥♥ you up. It is extemely difficult when you get to the second half of the game and those annoying ♥♥♥♥ing mutants come out. Nevertheless , the gameplay is what makes this game great. It has great variety of guns , vehicles and it has an open way to complete your objectives. But like I said , everything gets thrown out of the window when the second half of the game comes. Think of it as the dark souls of fps games. Anyway I highly recommend you try this out as this is a must play true classic and you will notice how different this is from your typical cod and battlefield.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
												I played this game when it first came out and I remember loving it, so I was excited to see it on Steam and find out how it's held up all these years later.  What a wonderful suprise that this game is even better than I remember it!  The graphics may be a little dated compared to what's out right now, but they still hold up pretty good, especially the atmosphiric effects in some of the indoor maps, with distortion from steam coming out of vents and shifting shadows from swinging light fixtures.  The engine is fantastic, with great hit detection and a smooth solid shooting feel, although I did have some problems getting stuck in doorways or on ramps.  The AI is also not the brightest, but sometimes the mercenaries on the island did a pretty good job flanking me and popping out of the jungle where I wasn't expecting them.My favorite thing about this game is the amazing setting; a lush tropical island for the player to explore.  It seems that every new map has something cool to check out, from Japanese WWII relics to sandy atol outpost to misty mountaintop research stations.  The story is pretty generic, but it does a good job at propelling you from one interesting predicament to the next.  If you have never played this game, give it a shot.  I honestly think it's superior to all of the Farcry sequels, and also a lot of other FPS games I've played in recent years.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												Brutal, but fun!This is a terrific adventure through a tropical island filled with soldiers and Trigen and mutated Trigen soldiers, oh my! The way I played through it was by steal-nah, who am I kidding? I shot my way through everything in this game. Beware, the difficulty is very high, even on normal (the mode I played on). It is not so much that the AI is very attentive or breaks out of the basic mold games have for NPCs. No, the enemies can hit you from the furthest spots imaginable, and this can be quite a pain. However, it offers several checkpoints in its linear, but still open-world linear, levels. You are Jack Carver and you must make your way through an island filled with enemies out to kill you. Halfway through the game you find out that this is no normal island and scientific experiments are being conducted on...well, I won't spoil it, but it becomes more than what it seems at first. I would recommend playing through each level, taking a deep breath after you are done with one before moving on to the next level. This game offered quite a challenge and I can only imagine the difficulty it would have been had I played on the two higher modes...ugh! Overall, 8/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												Very, very good game. One of the few genuinely difficult games that I've played. (Note that I only have ~10 hours on record on Steam, but I've played far more on a disc install before I had steam!) On the high difficulties, the enemies are far too good for the player to take the CoD approach and just run in guns-blazing.If you're not an experienced FPSer, then no way will you be able to manage the top difficulty levels; even if you are, then you'll still find it very challenging and rewarding!As others have said, there aren't many checkpoints, which can be a bit annoying... but I think it's a good thing: you have to remain focused the whole time; just meeting a pair of enemies when you're not paying attention, then you can die (not usual, but completely possible), which I think is great.The game definitely starts off better than it ends: I prefer playing against people than mutant monkeys, personally.At the moment it's only £1.74 on Steam. A game of this quality, for that price ? I can't think of one reason why you shouldn't buy it!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												Great Game, looks fantastic for its age. Oddly enough, in most games the cutscenes look better than the actual game, here it is th eopposite, the cutscenes are a bit clunky and jarring, but still have their charm. The Missions are wide open so there are plenty of routes to take to get to the end, especially the missions with multiple islands. This is cool, especially when you can choose to be stealthy, snipe your opponents, or just run in guns a-blazing!The game is pretty challenging even on the lower difficulties. You will have to replay certains parts over and over again, until you finally learn all the enemy patterns and placement, and can do the section near-flawlessly. Checkpoint system is really good with multiple checkpoints per level, however certain checkpoints are a bit too far apart. Driving is a bit clunky, but there is something about first-erson driving in these types of games, that I just love. Finally the last few levels will most likely make you pull your hair out in frustration, I think they could have provided a bit more health and armor packs.All in all great, classic FPS Adventure!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Well, yes and no. It can be good, but lots of other FPS games are better.It has a lot of good things; the open environment works surprisingly well, the many boats, cars and so on are a lot of fun and sniping and using googles is great. But it also has a lot of problems: First of all, the autosave is horrible, often I had to replay a lot I already had cleared a dozen times before I could get to the one point I had a problem with. We should just be allowed to save ourselves. Second, the zoom is very very old fashioned with all weapons lacking special scopes, like ordinary M4 machine guns. It looks horrible "zooming" with them. Thirdly, and possible most important, it indulge you to play stealth, sneaking around and so on, and most of the outdoor game looks like this was the way it was meant to play. BUT it is more or less impossible. Even on the easier levels the enemies are often simply impossible to sneak close to or around. When I got tired of trying about 20 times, I just front out assaulted a heavy defend fortress, and won. This I have tried several times in the game. It is far easier just going on a rampage up front killing everything than trying just to sneak around one enemy. Fourth, it is simply to long and, especially because of the lousy autosave, it really feels long. Fifth, it got lots of bugs. If you succed to sneak kill the enemies before they awaken their friends, there might happen a bug where the normal damage system no longer functions. For example, one place in the game, I sprayed a chopper with 8 missiles, nothing happened. Then I tried from the save point again, sprayed with 20 machine gun bullets just for the heck of it, and it blew up... Lots of other bugs also exist. And lastly, neither the plot, especially the anti-climatic ending, nor the gameplay is exciting enough to justify the long gameplay. It just become too much the same, to tedious. All in all, this game can be worth playing, but so are hundred of other games that I would advise you to prefer over this.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Though not the deepest of experiences, and still quite a tall order on even a modern non-gaming PC, Far Cry is still pretty fun. But be warned-- behind the reassuring veneer of campy-as-hell voice acting and action setpiece-packed first hour or so, this game is pretty hard, yo. The checkpoints are sparsely laid, and getting past every enemy camp is a twenty-minute ordeal of tagging all the enemies with the binoculars, taking out the snipers, waiting for someone to wander off alone, shooting them, moving to a new hiding spot, waiting for the heat to die down, and repeating. This is all because attempting anything other than the methodical stealthy approach will get you swiftly killed, because the player character's bullet resistance is vaguely realistic, and the enemies can see you from literally a mile away.Essentially, this is the poor man's version of Crysis, in which you have to take on a vast army in the jungle alone and without a superpowered nanosuit because you don't own a NASA supercomputer.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												10 years later, this is still one of the best first person shooters I've ever played. Not a ton of weapons but good choices and great mechanics. The open world approach is awesome and the stealth system is perfect. The story is good despite the cheesily delivered voiceovers. I especially loved how the atmosphere is further realized when you pay attention to the banter between mercs. The checkpoint save system was a tad annoying especially since a few of the bossfights I thought were unnecessarily tough. This game is the perfect blend of oldschool and new, and everyone should play through it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Awful cheesy writing. Good Controls...impossible scenarios. Kind of like the action movies we all loved from the 80s, in video game form. But impossibly long...everytime I thought it was going to be over or near the end it just keeps going. In some ways i'd like to consider that high value, but I guess for me I prefer my FPS games a bit shorter. One other complaint that I am sure is included in most other reviews, is there is a terrible glitch that causes the enemy to easily target and shoot you through walls in some areas, as if the wall isn't even there. This can get very annoying at times. But thankfully it only occurs in certain places, and you can adapt your strategy to work around this problem.I suspect when it came out this game introduced a lot of new concepts to the FPS genre, and even by todays standards it isn't a terrible game. However I don't know that playing it is really necessary unless you're hardcore and want to play every FPS or every Far Cry game in the series. Final Verdict: Not amazing by today's standards (obviously as it has been around for at least a decade). I wouldn't recommend for the casual FPS player like myself. However for those looking for older style FPS game play with higher difficulty which requires a bit of strategy and guerrilla tactics, and a lack of gimmicks that make the game easier (like slow-mo in F.E.A.R.) this game is still pretty solid.2004 Rating: 9/10 (1 point off for the cheesy scenes with Val)2014 Rating: 7/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3, 2013
												This game has terrible voice acting, a sub-par storyline, and infuriating gameplay at times, and yet I find myself wanting to triumph over it all the more. This is an excellent game if you like a challenge or are a masochist. If you think you find yourself replaying the same segment repeatedly early on, just wait until about halfway through the game when the enemies that are capable of jumping across the map and slashing at your face to kill you in two hits even though you have a full set of armor and are completely healthy are given rocket launchers. Were you having fun progressing the story line? Too bad, you're going to be there for at least three hours popping blood vessels in your head from all of your irritatingly failed attempts at making it to the next checkpoint just so you don't have to complete the segment a seventy sixth time. I never considered myself a decent gamer, by any means, but I have never had this much trouble getting through a game on the normal difficulty. It is the most unforgiving gameplay I have ever subject myself to and yet each small accomplishment makes you strive for more. It is difficult, but not impossible. It feels very rewarding to complete and I would recommend it to anyone looking for something difficult. I wouldn't necessarily if it weren't so cheap, but as it stands, I'd say it's worth it.

(nope)...I love this game, but I just want it to be over.14 hrs: We blew up the stuff, we're going to ride off into the sunset... content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Far cry is a game truly unlike any other. The AI is actually smart, you HAVE to have a different strategy for each mission, there is a wide variety of weapons, the absolutely beautiful enviroment (considering this is a game from 10 years ago), and it never gets old to see one of the mercenaries blow up. These are the main pros in this game. Some cons include the AI being a bit too smart (e.g. knowing where you are and shooting you while you are in a tent. It's like the walls aren't even there), and it is really not "open world". You can go wherever, but it would be EXTREMELY difficult to survive considering the helicopters that come at you. In conclusion, I seriously love this game and anyone who is a fan of a good FPS needs this in his/her library.

												Decent FPS for its time, but it has some flaws.  It has some bugs do a google search to find patches and fixes.  It has some game design issues as well.  1)  Enemies that can kill you very quickly (2 - 3 hits) and that are hard to kill.  This happens even at the lower difficulty  2) Stealth only works in certain circumstances  3)  Some enemies seem to have the force and feel your presence from across a valley and can then shoot you.  Worth buying if it is on sale for $5 or less.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												One of my personal favorites. Revolutionary for its time when it was released in 2004, it feels a little anachronistic at times with it's ex-special-forces-turned-alcoholic protagonist (complete with bad one-liners with even worse delivery), it's then-cutting-edge technology (drivable rocket-armed Humvees, and Ospreys taken straight from Half-Life 1), and characteristically mid-2000's habit of constantly trying to show off its physics engine and bump-mapped textures.It's nothing like modern Far Cry, but it's a blast to play, especially for its price.

												I've played this game before it was on steam. I would say it is the best of all Far Cry games, as I don't like the grindy open world aspect of the later Far Cry titles. This feels exactly like a prequel to Crysis, it is very similar, as it was developed by Crytek.The story is not very deep, mostly a motivation to kill everyone and blow up evertyhing. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												I got so nostalgic while listening this game soundtrack, that I decided to write a review to express my feelings about this game. For me it's the best one in franchise, because I enjoyed it most. Of course this wouldn't have happen if I'd play this game now for the first time, but back in 2004 it was a breakthrough in gaming industry. Amazing graphics, giant levels, ragdoll physics, interesting characters, randomly talking enemies with many different lines. This game was so immersive for me, and also challenging and scary as f**k at some moments.. Like others said, there is no "easy" difficulty in this game, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the hell our of it.I also wanted to emphasize the soundtrack. I is absolutely gorgeous, it created so deep atmosphere, it managed to keep me trying to pass difficult moments, to not give up. I consider it one of the best soundtracks that I've ever heard. And it's value can only be appreciated if you hear it in game, because it's perfect for Far Cry.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 3, 2016
												     This game, was the third game I have ever played, and the first FPS I was able to play. It is incredibly fun, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a singleplayer FPS experience with great gameplay and a very nice and well thought out story. Despite it's age, it's graphics are still amazing (if you care about that sort of thing).      It is also a bit more challenging than your modern day shooters. On FC3 I can crank the difficulty up to Master and still destroy everything, but as the game itself says, when you go to Realistic, "You must be amazingly skilled or incredibly foolish. Forget paradise - this is hell." Since my first playthrough of this game my skill in FPS games has increased tenfold, yet I can still die fairly easily on even Medium difficulty. Don't let that discourage you though, because if you want to just play for the story you can always go on Easy mode.      I could spend hours talking about how good this game is, but this should sum it up: It's one of those games where you think it is so good you wish you could forget you ever played it and play it over again. Only a few games have ever made me feel this way, Planetside 2, Far Cry 3, Skyrim, just to name a few. All in all I highly recommend this game, and as others have said, get this game even if it's not on sale.Final Verdict:10/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 6, 2011
												Farcry is an interesting game in that it is entertaining just by noticing the sheer vastness the game allows for you to explore different ways to achieve your goals. While the story and characters are nothing new to the action-genre of videogames (and movies), the fun of the game comes from how the environment is executed. When the game is played at the best graphic options (which I had trouble with due to the age of the software) the series of islands where the adventure takes place is simply astounding and colorful. The controls and gameplay are well spot-on, and the difficulty increases as you procees along, occasionally getting you stuck in certain points in the game. Don't play this if you are looking for a story-oriented adventure, but if you want to fight in a well-designed tropical environment with your guns and tactics, you should buy this classic.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
Sometimes Nostalgia is best left in the pastNostalgia is a funny thing, I first played Far Cry back in 2006 or something on my first PC I'd ever owned. It was a Dell Laptop and could only run the game at minimum setting but I could bump the resolution up so at the time I remember thinking it looked amazing. Far Cry does not hold up to the test of time in terms of Graphics as we've become accustomed to much better looking games but it is 10 years old at this point so thats acceptable. I remember the game being more serious but with all the action movies I've seen and the modern shooters I've played since then it felt very corny which is not a bad thing just goes to show how your mind changes over time and under different circumstances.I discovered a few different things playing it this time around. There are Bugs and they are noticeable such as emeries shooting through tents. Secondly the game is harder then I remember, like... MUCH HARDER.... on NORMAL, I died a lot and in a few cases I had to go back a checkpoint to make sure I had more health and armor but I got through it in 8.8 hours so I guess it wasn’t too bad. What I put this down to is I'm more impatient then I was back when I was a kid which I can put down to the conditioning process of modern gameplay.On the positives it’s a nice change of pace to go back to a game that uses Health and Armor that you have to find and collect. Every modern shooter uses the whole health regen which from a gameplay perspective I understand but the good thing about having to find health kits is you need to be aware of your health at all times and maintain it through-out the level. Ammo was never really an issue, Sniper and Rockets can be difficult to find as they only spawn sometimes in armories and from dead enemies who have that weapon. In the other side of things Rocket Enemies were by far the most annoying enemies to face the moment they spot you... from all the way across the map they fire rockets at you which do a TON of damage and if you’re in a vehicle and don’t realize you just blow up. It's pretty normal that I would spot all the issues with the game this time around and not back when I first played it. I only had a few games back then such as Warcraft 3, Call of Duty 1 and Star Wars Battlefront 1 so I couldn't really pick and choose and just had to enjoy what I had, I was also like 10 so I didn't even know what a "bug" was xDMultiplayer is non-existent, I remember playing it a few times over LAN with my friends and it was fun.6.6/10Still a good game, some bugs, very hard old-school shooter

content:
Posted: September 2, 2011
												I still remember the days when I didn't understand the concepts of "realistic shooter' or 'cover based combat'. I was hooked on the whole cheat code craze until I finally grew a pair and took off the training wheels of Easy difficulty. So, I decided to give Far Cry a second look after avoiding it as a kid. I must say that you're pretty fleshy on the inside and body armor is pretty much cardboard, but the same rules apply to enemies as well. The M-16 will be your most trusted companion and don't you ever forget it. The Cry-Tek engine hasn't aged well, that's for sure. Everything looks pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥ but I remember the review of this game at the time, and it was very pretty. So much vegitation and plants...not that they'll hide you, that red shirt of yours is very revealing. If CoD bores you and you want to try the first realistic shooter that I remember being made, give Far Cry a try.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												One of my all time favorite childhood games.. that I absolutly loved so I bought it thinking: I coud really  refresh my childhood. So first Ill cover my 1# and 2# experience. I fired it up on medium and begin to play. I quickly realized that it is actualy a hard game to master.. so yeah it ain't COD. But after a while I rememberd the playstyle and was progressing like crazy... finished the game in 5 or so hours(yeah I know not the best time in the world but the heck with it).. I was having a blast so I thought to myself: I shoud play on realistic when I beat the game... So after I beat the agme I fired the realistic setting and began to play.HOOOOLY ♥♥♥♥ WHAT JUST HAPPENED? o__O For example: at the buggy shooting level I got rekt lets say aprox. 300 times before I got through the level.I got rekt.. I coudn't just blaze through the jungle and underground like crazy, but I actually had to plan, make a strategy and hide in the bushes, air vents and peek corners, sometimes even run the F**K away from the trigens(seriosly those things are ♥♥♥♥ing scary when they sneak attack you and you have headphones on). So yeah it was a very hard experience for me when playing in realistic, but I love hard challenges. Now the VA for Jack Carver. Ubisoft WHAT DID YA DOO?... Im not even kidding... I coud do a better job as voicing the main charather(Peter Thais)... Im not sure if he is just so bad at voice acting or did Ubisoft repeat the lines so long as he got to this point... CringeworthyWeapons receive the same careful treatment and are nicely balanced. The M4 can switch to single shot semi-automatic mode to pick off guys at medium range, but the sniper rifle is of course far superior. However, rifle ammo is precious throughout the game, so you won't be able to wander around and cap people like some distant hand of God. Grenades are also a good addition. And found myself using them quite a lot on realistic difficulty. While the actual plot was a pretty thin and the dialogue a SOOo cheesy, there were still a ton of great moments and scenes. The graphics are also very very good for the given year and the view distance of about 1 kilometer is pretty good..So I woud say if your going to start the far cry franchise I woud definetly start at number 1 as it is my favorite of all of the others. Needless to say BUY IT NOOOW... and anjoy the beauty of what crytek has created

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
												This game was one of my early childhood favourites, if only for the fact that my father couldn't play the game without god mode, and whenever I stepped in I would easily get around his problem.Farcry is different from all of its offspring in the sense that Farcry focuses on a semi-linear path. While you are still out in the jungle trying to survive, you always have a sense of where you need to go. However, this game is brutal on new players, and still is brutal on me today.Pros:- Semi-linear path, with only one objective. You always know what you are doing.- The first game in its series, and if I must say, my personal favourite.- Despite an out-of-date engine, it still easily supports modern hardware and operating systems- Several hours of gameplay guaranteed. Several days of gameplay highly probable.Cons:- Outdated engine: This is evident in vehicles and aiming instantly. While it doesn't prevent you from winning, it will be very off-putting if you just came out of a more modern game.- Outdated Graphics: Grass is a lot more annoying than it would be in modern games, and the lack of detail speaks for itself as you walk through bases and foliage.- Difficulty is a bit intense: Players may find themselves dying over and over simply because they made a poor decision earlier on, or messed something up, even on easy. Thankfully each checkpoint creates its own save, meaning you can roll back until you think you stand a chance.Check out some of the mods for this♥♥♥♥♥♥

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 21, 2012
												About an 11-13 hour game on medium.  Old game, runs well on modern systems.  I think there's a high-res texture pack I used or something?  I forget.Anyway, this game is... alright, but its way, WAY too flawed in some areas to be an enjoyable classic of some sort.  Enemy AI is either hyper aware or extremely unaware, usually tending towards the former.  Enemy accuracy is a bit ridiculous and since they never run out of ammo, expect an unending steam of rocket launcher pinpoint strikes if you ever decide to eschew the sniper rifle.Difficulty is a bit whack because it uses the old Health Pack + Armor pickup system, and some enemies can 2-shot you from full health+armor or come in huge groups at the end of the game.Speaking of, jeez this game is long for an FPS, and the pacing is none too enjoyable either because the events arent  interesting.  This is probably just my complaint of one of the pitfalls of FPSs, just like random encounters in RPGs.  Locations are fairly well designed.Also, enemies are not hindered in locating you by any object that can be penetrated by a bullet, and they will easily shoot you through canvas walls.The game suffered no real performance issues which is good (3.2ghz * 6, HD6850, 8gb RAM), controls were customizable with a modern mult-button mouse, and the music was not super memorable and a bit repetative but thankfully not grating. The story is predictable enough, nothing to write home about. Enemies do have convos you can listen in on via your binoculars which adds some atmosphere, but its no Metro 2033.If you want an older-gen FPS game with some length then by all means, pick this up on a steamsale.

												I just finished the story today, and I have to say this was one of the most difficult games I have played in a while. I found myself getting stuck on certain checkpoints quite often even though I would consider myself an experienced FPS gamer. I should also mention I played the game through on medium difficulty, and was still consistently challenged. The rocket launcher enemies in particular were a big problem for me.The story is pretty cheesy in my opinion, and the game is really just about killing every enemy in your path on your way to your objective, then getting a new one and repeating.But overall the combat and weapons are fun and it's not a bad game especially for it's time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Thank you Steam ... no longer do I have to open my tray and insert my battered 'Jack Carver' FarCry disks that have cost me hours of my life in the last ten or so years! For the price of a soda you have made my day! Guess who died in the tutorial with this new purchase? Anybody who hasn't been a fan of FPS b4 should grab this for many reasons. Subtle humour is one of them " You're a real funny guy Carver ". Even the cutscenes are good. The baddies are very bad and can be deadly depending on your difficulty level the mutants (Trigens) especially. The story is good and the locations are a tropical paradise (a little comic book by today's standards of graphics). Driving crazy vehicles including dune buggies and blowing stuff up is just a sideline. I always managed to reach areas that seemed to be 'off limits' on the mesh with persistent effort so I could do some juicy sniping in one or two places which was a gleeful bonus at the time. Great variety of maps with each episode and consistent action is also empowered with an amazing soundtrack! I loved hang-gliding too and this game was probably an incentive to other games that followed in it's shadow. For it's time and it's price and to save your disk drive wear and tear this is a worthy little gem of history!
